title: Togo
summary: The story of Togo, the sled dog who led the 1925 serum run despite being considered too small and weak to lead such an intense race.

reviews.content: What an amazing film/story of this remarkable dog named Togo. I watched this film with my 11 year old daughter and we were both struggling to keep the tears 😭 from falling. At the end my daughter was crying cause it was so touching. A REAL movie to watch!

This is the first time that I think Walt Disney Picture did a great job on this amazing movie. A movie that deserves to be called "Mission Impossible!" Willem Dafoe and Julianne Nicholson both are great. The screenplay writer Tom Flynn gave us a straightforward plot, simple but amazing scenario that has made this movie so suspenseful, thrilling, at the same time, profound. Director Ericson Core also won my praise wholeheartedly. The special effects team did a wonder too, many scenes I just couldn't believe possible to make, but they just looked so real and so powerful. The crossing lake scenes are just ridiculously fascinating. The leading dog's performance is just beyond any word could describe, and the poppy that played Togo's younger age would allow you to understand what "cute" really means. Willem Dafoe, what a great actor! Julianne Nicholson, her natural talent completely shinning through the whole movie. Every part of this movie is a fulfilled perfection, it also owes to the great casting job, through the lens of the camera, offering you great cinematography, followed by a perfect editing job....The almost impossible mission, the dogs, the great couple and the great town people...all together, have made this movie THE VERY BEST MOVIE at the year end of 2019.Highly recommended!

reviews.review_title: A historical correction for true heroes!
reviews.content:
The wife and I watched this movie last night and were just blown away.
This is the true story of the sled dog team and it's owner who carried the medicine in Alaska to rescue Nome Alaska during he 1925 Diphtheria epidemic.
In much worse than normal blizzard conditions, the sled driver risked all to take a shortcut across a thawing body of water, thus saving 90 miles from his trip.
The movie reveals how the wrong dog, "Balto" was credited with the ordeal...and it is to the Disney studios for making the correction.
It reveals how even back then, the press was more eager to "get the story" than to "get the facts".The wife and I were blessed to have lived for sixteen years with a grey timber wolf...and we understand how an emotional attachment remains long after such a friendship can exist.
The acting and photography are perfect and if this film does not go to the Oscars under several categories, then the nominating panel may be as flawed as many are starting to think they are.
...as I've always heard only about Balto, who was commemorated. This is an excellent, heartfelt film, revealing the heroism of the dogs, particularly Togo.

Greetings from Lithuania."Togo" (2019) was a very good, old school movie. By saying that i mean that it relaid on a story well told, and not special effects. There are good characters in this movie, but true star(s) of this film are dogs. They were amazing - and not CGI made! You do feel the difference.Overall, "Togo" was a really involving movie for all its running time. Its was sometimes funny, sometimes sad and always true and very good.
Willem Dafoe and a bunch of adorable sled dogs star in this heartwarming, action packed new movie based on a true story... The sequences involving Togo as a mischievous pup are pure magic.

I admit it, I'm a sentimentalist. I cried like a baby at my own wedding while my wife looked on in bemusement. I weep at favourite songs or pieces of music and shed tears freely at emotionally charged movies. It was my wife's brother who recommended we watch this movie during lockdown and I really should have read the signs. First off it's a Disney movie, secondly it's about a brave dog ...and right from these two facts, I knew I was going to struggle to get through it dry-eyed.And so it proved. With films like this, for me anyway, critical faculties are suspended and you just want it all to end happily so that you don't have to hide your feelings anymore. I do know that Willem Dafoe and Julianne Nicholson were excellent in their parts as the slightly mismatched couple who set up home in the remote, frozen, northernmost part of America. He's the local "mush-man" responsible for trekking his team of husky dogs over unforgiving terrain for the benefit of the local community while she provides all the back-up back home he needs for them both to keep their operation going.Comes a catastrophic diphtheria outbreak to the town, especially targeting young children and the need to requisition urgent medical supplies from some 500 miles or so away, but with an impending spell of bad weather knocking out the possible use of aeroplane or rail transport, the only way to go get the job done is for Dafoe and his dog's to undertake a hazardous cross-country trek like no other to collect the vaccines and get them to the hospital to help save the kids' lives.With a storyline given added topicality and piquancy by the devastating Covid-19 virus outbreak, this was a thrilling and moving race against time, taking on the elements and indeed the odds, the effort spearheaded by crusty old Dafoe and his pack, especially Togo the pack-leading dog. Early on we're fed the back story of how Togo came into the couple's possession and how the dog's irrepressible desire to accompany Dafoe on his travels sees him twice unsuccessfully try to offload the dog to new owners, only for Togo to somehow find a way to break free and return back home from whence he came, Finally Dafoe is persuaded by the dog's errr... doggedness, to reluctantly road-test the apparently under-sized dog and eventually concede that its courage and stamina outweigh any physical disadvantages it may have.We see the pack endure unbelievable dangers in their epic mission, Togo literally pulling out all the stops to navigate the team over breaking ice-floes, slog up snow-bound foot-hills and even save the group from certain doom near the end, in a particularly amazing show of love, strength and fortitude by the dog.It's a Disney film so there's probably a fair bit of dramatic licence taken with the story but you'll have a good idea how it ends. The landscapes, making great use of drone shots on-high are frequently eye-catching and there's was a plaintive lonesome-violin soundtrack which further set the scene. I don't know how much of the cinematography was C-Gen assisted but the actions of the dogs and Togo in particular, looked natural to me.Anyway I got through to the end with some dust in my eyes and immediately afterwards felt the need to hug our own dog of over ten years in sympathy and appreciation for what I'd just seen.This one's for you, Flip.

reviews.review_title: As a person who dislikes dog related films, I loved this.
reviews.content: Togo is the first win for Disney+ (in terms of movies) Togo is a legitimately great film and such a surprise. It is filled with a lot of heart and backed up by a great performance from Dafoe.Willem Dafoe is really great here. Delivering one of his better movies. His relationship with the dogs is done in such a really nice and heartfelt way. That's what makes it better than most dog films. It's a really enjoyable film and by the end it is really touching. That's thanks to them using a brilliant music choice of "in the nature of daylight" as well as the bond and development you get between the Dafoe and Togo.I don't really have any major flaws with it. I think it's a great story especially for not being familiar with the true story. The visual effects aren't always top notch but that's understandable due to being a disney original and a not a cinema film.Overall it's a really solid film, and genuinely the best dog film, we might have ever had, it might not be overly sad but it has heart and thats more than I can ask for coming from a dog film.

reviews.review_title: He is not a sled dog, he's the lead dog
reviews.content: So let me guess if you have ever been a pet owner, I'm sorry, a dog owner and watch this movie you will probably cry like in every 10 minutes, maybe five

reviews.review_title: After thinking it over I can't find any flaws or things I would change - my highest rating ever
reviews.content: If you are a dog lover this is a must-see film! In fact, unless you hate dogs, this is one of the best animal films I've ever seen. That includes Call of the Wild.This may be the best performance of Willem Dafoe's career so it is also a must-see for any of his fans.

reviews.review_title: True appreciation of a dog's heroism
reviews.content: Unlike the false sentimentality of Balto or Hachiko, this film shows the true heroism of a historic dog with all the nitty gritty details. The eponymous character is brave, energetic and loyal - but he is also mischievous, chaotic and stubborn. The relationship with Seppala is one characterised by both love and rebellion, befitting the true nature of a dog. Credit must be given to the filmmakers for the realistic and harrowing portrayal of a dog's tough journey through the brutal Alaskan winter. The flashbacks imparted a great deal of context and personality to Togo, which goes a long way when he can't speak!

No really, this is an actual great film to watch. Which is getting harder and harder to say these days with films made within the past 5 years or so. This film does it right, tells a story and builds on it with good acting and all the other things you need to help keep eyeballs and brains caring about what is in the screen. I will not spoil it for you, just watch it.

At this point, I don't care if every dog movie involves the same themes, emotional beats, or endings, if the movie sucks me in emotionally it will get my approval. Togo is a film that I was almost completely unaware of until a few weeks ago when I saw the trailer. A tale of bravery, loyalty, and an underDOG that was unfairly forgotten about for decades, Togo is one of the best films of the year no one is talking about. An absolute win on every level as Willem DaFoe and company prove there is still plenty of room for a dog movie in a crowded marketplace every once and again. Check that, I'll take one once a week.9.5/10

With all the blockbusters being constantly cranked out for our consumption, it's great to come across a heartwarming story so expertly told. Once you realize this is a true story, it's even more amazing as you really can't believe the events actually happened. William Dafoe does a great job at playing a tough guy with a warm heart. You'll find yourself in awe of this true hero story and if you're like me you'll be choking back the tears. Great movie for the family. Enjoy.

My wife and I just finished watching this movie on Disney plus streaming services and upon completion I researched facts based on the film for the next hour. The movie was entertaining, with some comedy and drama. Based on the 1925 Nome Alaska diphtheria outbreak. The movie is factually based and it amazes me how the world got the story wrong for close to 100 years. I would highly recommend this movie for any family

It's 1925. Leonhard Seppala (Willem Dafoe) drives his dog sled home to Nome, Alaska and his wife Constance (Julianne Nicholson) ahead of an epic storm. The team is led by his beloved lead dog Togo. There is a diphtheria outbreak which threatens the town's children and there is only one man who can travel the distance to retrieve the needed serum. His dire quest becomes a media sensation.This is an old fashion Disney doggie movie in the best way. It is Based on a true story. It has its thrills. It is heart-warming. It's a simple adventure. Dafoe is great. The ice stuff is fantastic. The Balto bit is the cherry on top. This is Disney at its old fashion finest.

Stunning, truly stunning.As I pressed play on 'Togo' and began watching the initial scenes unfold, I was expecting a rehash/retread on Disney's previous films on this sort - e.g. 'White Fang' or 'Iron Will'. Those are good in their own right, but this 2019 film - which is about a true story - takes things to another dimension.It tugs at the heartstrings profusely, from the first scene to the very last. It's superbly written, with there being a fair amount of surprises in terms of how the story unfolds. It's shot beautifully and put together, via the set design etc., excellently, while the score is magnificent.Then you have the dogs, who are insanely charming throughout - especially, of course, the star that is Togo (Diesel). There's many a moment with him that produce all the feelings, from joy to sorrow to everything in between. The dogs are great and incredibly adorable.Away from all of that, you have an outstanding performance from Willem Dafoe. Before seeing this, the most I remember of him is his role in 'Mr. Bean's Holiday'. This now takes over in those regards, it's a brilliant job done by Dafoe. Julianne Nicholson merits praise, also.What a film. Not what I was expecting whatsoever, in the nicest possible way. Glad to see it has also been highly rated online. A must-watch!

Good acting, good pace, more than a Dog film. Rare too from Disney these days as it has no propaganda. Warning its emotional but well worth it. If you loved this film it worth looking up the story after as some of it is even more amazing in reality.
Just an incredible movie. I can't say enough about how enjoyable this was. After the movie I had to research all about Togo and the great run. One I must highly recommend to all.

reviews.review_title: An incredible true story, told perfectly.
reviews.content: Stunning landscapes, excellent cinematography, outstanding directing and a perfect performance by all cast, including the dogs. Willem Dafoe and Togo's bond felt genuine. The 113 min run-time felt a little long, maybe should've been shortened by 15-20 mins and/or the pacing picked up. Otherwise, an incredible true story, told perfectly. A must-see and a deserving 9/10 from me.

reviews.review_title: A story of Togo the brave presented by the timeless Willem Dafoe.
reviews.content:
"Togo, the most heroic animal of all time." - Time Magazine 2011 .I mean that title alone should just make you wanna watch the story instantly ..
Willem Dafoe did an amazing job and the idea of this story being true is just beyond amazing.The setting and the cinematography were professionally done, and Ericson Core has done a commendable job on the directing.Watch it now.

reviews.review_title: A fantastic surprise. One of the best Disney film's in years!
reviews.content: Arriving without much fanfare or expectation to the recently made available Disney + streaming service, you'd not be the only one heading into Togo with zero to minimal hopes for a film that on paper seems like the perfect middle tier type production, but throwing those feelings out the window is a dog-centric true life tale that is some of the best original work The Mouse House has done in the last decade.Likely to join beloved recent canine filled film's like Hachiand Red Dog in the hearts of movie-goers across the globe, Togo tells the heartwarming and nigh on unbelievable true story of heroic Alaskan sled dog Togo, who alongside his owner and trainer Leonhard Seppala saved the lives of countless children in a secluded snow incased town in 1925.Known as the famed 'serum run', highlighted in animated film Balto and well known throughout the United States, the deeds of Togo and Seppala allows unassuming director Ericson Core, his lead performer Willem Dafoe (does this man know how to deliver a bad turn?) and his core team of four-legged stars too combine together to deliver one of the most enjoyable and powerful family adventures of recent times.Not at all feeling like the direct to streaming offering that it is, Togo feels grand and cinematic in all the right ways as we join Seppala and his sled team as they precariously venture out into the storm clad wilds of the unforgiving Alaskan surrounds, while Core's well-played out and downright enjoyable detours showcasing Togo and Seppala's early relationship is sure to appease even the most cold-hearted of viewers.In many ways Togo never messes with the true story Disney formula that has been a staple of the company for many a moon but there's a special something found in almost every aspect of this confidently made and respectful outing, that's clear affiliation for its subject and subject matters ensures that it's an engaging experience from start to emotionally powerful finish.It's a journey that will take viewers on a wild ride of varying emotions from laughter, tension and more than likely a few well-deserved tears (honestly damn you and your dastardly ways On The Nature of Daylight) as you can't help but fall head over heels for one very faithful and special pup and his commitment to his cause that has stood the test of time for almost 100 years, as one of the most exceptional examples of the bond between man and his best friend.Final Say -One of the most surprisingly outstanding releases of the last 12 months, Togo is a standout Disney + release and a likely candidate for one of the most beloved new Disney films of the modern era.4 1/2 barn escapes out of 5

"Togo" is a Biography - Adventure movie in which we watch the story of a sled dog and his owner, Leonhard Seppala, who traveled to receive and transfer a package of medicine to cure some cases of Diptheria. They have to travel through a strong storm and overcome many obstacles.I liked this movie very much firstly because it is based on true events and secondly due to its great direction, plot and interpretations by its cast. Despite that the story is simple, it has plenty of suspense and does not let you be calm through its whole duration, something that I found extraordinary. Willem Dafoe's interpretation as Leonhard Seppala helped on that since he was simply outstanding. The flashbacks were also very helpful for the character building and also helped us understand the bond between Togo and Leonhard Seppala, and how it was created. Some other interpretations that have to be mentioned were Julianne Nicholson's who played as Constance Seppala and Christopher Heyerdahl's who played as Mayor George Maynard. In conclusion, I have to say that "Togo" is an amazing movie and I highly recommend you to watch it because I am sure it will leave you speechless.
Great story and a true story to commemorate the real hero dog Togo. I wonder if they will change the statue in New York to reflect the dog that saved the day. Well worth watching

reviews.review_title: If you love Eight Below,you'll love this
reviews.content: Togo is a 2019 Disney movie based on true events about a man and his dog who sled through an Alaskan storm in 1925 and must keep at bay.The story is good, especially the acting from Willem Dafoe,(best known for Sam Rami's Spiderman franchise and The Fault In Our Stars as Van Howton), and the cinematography is really good.I'm surprised this never got a cinema release but I'm glad I saw it today on Disney +.

The movie has it all. Great script, great action sequences, beautiful cinematography and most importantly, emotion. Loved how the film shined the light in Togo, who in reality did all the work, not Balto. You will find yourself in awe and full of emotion throughout the film and I highly recommend it.

Togo is a heartbreaking movie based on a true story that's brimming with emotion.A very sad, historically-accurate, representational film of Togo, the dog who saved the inhabitants of Nome, Alaska by sledding the crates of sera hundreds of miles, with his team, back to Nome. This took place during the diphtheria epidemic, which was a tragic time when Alaskan children were having terrible coughs and illnesses.

reviews.review_title: A beautiful film handled with care and nuance with lots of heart and meaningful messages for children and families, without gratuitous emotional exploitation
reviews.content: Before you even watch this movie you see the reviews and you just know that the only way such a film is going to achieve such universal admiration is if there is a sentimental story about a dog that makes people smile and cry. And my eyes almost roll at how predictable its likely to be and because so often this type of film is just clever marketing trick to evoke audience emotion (eg Marley and Me) without nuance and when you step back you feel a bit duped even though you may have guiltily enjoyed the ride. However, Togo is one of those rare films that tows this line extra carefully and makes sure that the emotional rollercoaster is warranted and justified within the context of the story and is done in a meaningful and organic way. A big part of what helps it achieve this is knowing that this film is based on historical events, a real journey and a real dog, so you trust in the organicness and can invest in the characters without feeling you're being led to emotionally exploitation solely for a film studios purse. It is such a beautiful tale also with edge of your seat stuff action, but most importantly there is so much heart and depth and meaningful messages to be taken from it that is perfect for children and families. I'm sure this is an instant classic in many households and will endure for many years to come I am sure.

'Togo (2019)' finds its charm whenever it focuses on a very well-trained puppy portraying an intolerably untrainable one, and it finds its excitement whenever it focuses on the stylistic feats of sled-dog mastery required to navigate its focal Alaskan storm. Its action is an odd mix of real-life animal work and CGI set-pieces. However, its overall formalistic effect isn't entirely unsuccessful. It never comes close to feeling realistic but it evokes the effect it's going for. Some of it's actually suspenseful. The story isn't the most compelling, though it does have a good set-up and proper stakes. It just doesn't grip you, exactly. It's well-written but generally dry. A lot of it is just characters talking about how good its eponymous dog is. The relationship between the dog and his owner is tangible, though. The movie is entertaining enough throughout. Its overdone ending isn't the best note to go out on, but the experience is fairly enjoyable nevertheless. 6/10

I absolutely hate Disney, but this film was very well done. I like how the production went out of its way to not only make the story as accurate to historical accounts, but even made sure the characters really do look like the original people/dog. Williem Dafoe was the perfect cast.I also very much enjoy how the story was written. Instead of simply a linear story telling, it went with various flashbacks to tell the story of Togo while keeping the suspense in the current time frame.Overall, very heartwarming and deeply moving story about a man who fell in love with this dog.

reviews.review_title: It reminded me of my own one from long ago
reviews.content: "I always thought he lived for the sled when all along, what he lived for was me." Leonhard concludes about Togo at the end of the movie. If you have ever owned a dog and were really lucky, you know what that means. A dog like that dedicates his, in my case, her life to you. And before you could start to appreciate it, she's gone forever and leave you the great regrets for the rest of your life....

reviews.review_title: Great story- great movie- amazing dogs!
reviews.content: Watched it surrounded by six Siberian Huskies- but even without them - you really have to appreciate the beauty of this film and especially the dogs 💕

reviews.review_title: By far one the best movies of the year .
reviews.content: This movie was absolutely amazing from beginning to end . Dafoe delivers a stellar performance . Must watch .

It is best dog movie I ever seen! Megan Leavey is my second choice.
This movie touch my heart so much and its so awesome its a real story!

I had never even heard of the name "Togo" before I watched this movie. I couldn't believe a dog (Balto) that lead the last 20 miles got all the credit and no one bothered to set the story straight for 94 years? Such a shame. But thanks to the film makers and Disney for setting the record straight. This movie should have been released on an IMAX. Great performance by Willem dafoe and Juliane Nicholson and the dog that played "Togo". It's a Beautiful true story masterfully told and must be watched by all ages.

reviews.review_title: Edge of your seat adventure about a friendship between a man and a dog.
reviews.content: (Togo 4 out of 5 stars).Togo is a good adventure true story about Togo a leader husky of a dog sled. Where they travel hundred of miles to get medicine for a small town in Alaska. Facing against the harsh weather and a race against time to save kids who are sick with an epidemic illness. Its a great story. Togo was a stubborn and frustrating pup when Leonhard (Willem Dafoe) and wife Constance (Julianne Nicholson) first had him. Leonhard was a strict dog owner. No dogs on bed. He has huskies trained for a sled. Togo was always eager to be part of the sled. He would escape the dog pen or barn to interfere when Leonhard was out with his sled. When an epidemic sickness is infecting all the kids. The nearest town with medicine is 600 miles away. They organize a relay sledding team to transport the medicine. Which Leonhard and his sled led by Togo travel hundreds of miles to get the medicine to bring it back.The direction and script kept the movie moving at a fast pace. Putting Leonhard right into action with his travels. Facing against storms. A frozen lake cap. And edgy mountain trails. While the film flashes 12 years earlier to focus on Togos earlier years as a troublemaking puppy. Which was also fun and cute. The film has a thrilling and edge of your seat adventure sequences. While giving the audience a break throughout with flashing back to the earlier years with Leonhard not happy with the troublemaking Togo.Willem Dafoe and Julianne Nicholson are great with their characters. I have to say this is probably one of the best dog movies ever. With great acting. Good story. Exciting thrills. The setting was spectacular on capturing the beautiful landscape of Alaska and the snowy mountains.Ericson Core direction was great. He did great in setting up the action. Literally having us gripping the seat when Leonhard is riding the sled up on the mountains. And barely keeping on the edge. Or racing against the frozen lakes that are breaking into pieces. That scene was spectacular. The music score by Mark Isham was also good as well. The film does show a bond and friendship between Togo and Leonhard. And it can be emotional at times.Overall, Togo is a good film. If your looking for an exciting adventure film about a guy racing against time on a dog sled. This is worth checking out.

reviews.review_title: An inspiring tale of the relationship between humans and canines through the most challenging of hardships
reviews.content: Togo is a drama film based on the true story of the important people and dogs involved in the 1925 Alaskan serum run. Starring Willem Dafoe in the lead role, it is an inspiring tale of the relationship between humans and canines through the most challenging of hardships.In 1925, an outbreak of diphtheria develops in the Alaskan town of Nome, causing several young children to become seriously ill. In response to this, the mayor of Nome tasks sled dog musher Leonhard Seppala (Willem Dafoe) with traversing through the state to collect a serum and race back as quickly as possible. In spite of the serious snowy conditions, Seppala and his team of Siberian Huskies, led by the energetic, high-spirited Togo, set forth on this dangerous mission, determined to make it back with the serum no matter what.With its great use of landscape and solid acting, Togo goes above and beyond the normal human and dog bonding story to become an exhilarating adventure decades in the making. Throughout the film, we are constantly reminded of the loyalty and resilience of the Siberian Husky known as Togo, who always defies the odds in spite of his physical limitations. It was just so touching to watch as Togo trudges on through the harsh snowstorms and dangerous terrain, proving himself a valuable sled dog to his master Leonhard. Dogs truly are man's best friend and films like this serve to further emphasise this to us all.Director Ericson Core frequently uses creative wide open cinematography to show off how expansive the Alaskan scenery actually is. This helps give the feeling of how much ground Leonhard, Togo, and the rest of the sled team must cover in order to complete their mission in time. In addition to this, certain scenes kept me on the edge of my seat. One in particular involved the team travelling over ice sheets, as the cracking thin ice felt like it could break apart at any moment, reminding us that there is no time for procrastination.As per usual, Willem Dafoe gives a reliably strong performance in the main human role as Leonhard Seppala. Dafoe depicts Seppala with a stern yet caring demeanor, which according to some sources, was how he genuinely was in real life. Of course, the real star is Diesel, the Siberian Husky who plays the title dog himself. Not only is he absolutely adorable when he wants to be, but the stunts he pulls off are wonderful to watch as well. These dog breeds are known for their loyalty and companionship and it was nice to see this shown off in such a loving fashion.Overall, if you love dogs just as much as I do, then this film is well worth your time. Even if you believe you have seen all movies involving heroic dogs, this one still may have enough surprises to keep you invested. As previously stated, dogs are man's best friend and it never hurts to be reminded of this.I rate it 8.5/10

Incredible in so many aspects: Story, acting, dialogue, music, cinematography... and a dog's courage. Can't believe it took this much time to hear Togo's story, but the wait was worth it. Could very well be my favorite dog movie.

reviews.review_title: Humans must be thankful to live with dogs
reviews.content: Dogs are animals, but they are best animals and friends you can hope for. This movie shows how loyal, brave and intelligent dogs can be. Last five minutes of this great movie tears just flow down your eyes. Movie has wonderful nature, dogs and message. If you are lonely person, get a dog. He will give his life for you, and live for you.

REVIEW - TOGODifferent studios seem to release similar films at the same time, I don't know if you have noticed this but I certainly have and with the recent release of The Calll Of the Wild with Harrison Ford and the terrible scoop do animated dog there was another film released at the same time, TOGO.The difference between the 2 films, whilst set in the same area of the world is most striking in the stories, the dogs themselves but especially the acting, William Dafoe is simply amazing in this film where as Harrison Ford wasn't.Follow the inspired by true events, the story TOGO from being puppy to earning the respect from his owner and becoming the lead dog pulling his sled and one very dangerous but life saving journey.Bit confusing in places with the flashbacks but one very enjoyable film which actually pleasantly surprised me.Rating 8 out of 10

Disney finally manages to create a film that stands alone. Full of emotions, seriousness and love. What Disney put on the screen here is a little masterpiece. The cast with Willem Dafoe and his dog Togo is excellent.It is reminiscent of Jack London's wolf blood, and it only needs animals and humans and the tension and emotions are there. To this day, the dog Balto, who ran the last stage, counts as the hero, who even got a statue in Central Park. But it was Togo that ran most of the way. In this film he is finally given honor. A hero.

It was a wonderful film full of heartwarming moments. I couldn't keep my eyes dry. Very nice to see the real story behind the Great Race of Mercy and give credits to the real heroic dog: Togo. Magnificent movie, I really recommend it!

Togo was a Siberian Husky sled dog in 1925 who led a team through a storm in order to pick up a serum for children with diphtheria. It is a typically Disney feel good family film. I was captured from beginning to end. Willem Dafoe is great, as usual, but the star is the Husky who seems almost human. Togo belongs on every top ten list for 2019. The scenery is spectacular and every once in a while we are reminded of the potential of movie magic and Togo is a perfect example of it.
It's been awhile since a movie has brought me to tears......and I am BAWLING!!! Such a good movie!! Highly recommend!

reviews.review_title: I wish I could give this movie an 11
reviews.content:
Have you ever loved a dog?
I mean really loved one?If you have you will love this movie.It's a great story and well told.
We learn that Togo is the runt of the litter and early on has a determination that is not to be denied.This is a true story which makes the telling even better.It's interesting to know that Togo & Balto were trained by Sepp.
Because Balto runs the final lego of the Serum Race, he seems to have gotten all the notoriety. He ran 31 miles, while Togo ran 264 miles over some of the most treacherous terrain in Alaska.I've always liked Willem Defoe as an actor. Whenever I watch the Grand Budapest Hotel, his character just makes me laugh.In this film, he brings life to the character of Leohnard Seppala.
It is truly an inspirational story.
As I'm watching, I'm thinking of all the dogs that have been a part of my life.
If you have been a dog owner, you will understand.The best part, it's all true!The children live because they receive the drum in time.
All thanks to these brave dogs and their masters.Kudos to Disney for brining this story to the screen.I took my young Sons to Manhattan and Central park to see the statue of Balto. They should have one for Togo as well.

reviews.review_title: Would have enjoyed even more if I hadn't seen the rave reviews.
reviews.content: Don't get me wrong i still really enjoyed the film but given its average rating of 8.1 being higher than most Oscar winners or any film I've seen in a long time I was waiting for a masterpiece and a moment in which I'd feel blown away unfortunately I didn't get that. That being said it is still a very good film for all the family and keeps you interested throughout. Like I said I did really enjoy it but for me it isn't that exceptional standard of film to blow you away.

reviews.review_title: Best film I've seen this year
reviews.content: Pretty sure I'm going to end up crying whenever I think of this movie for years to come.Togo completely exceeded my expectations. It was epic, heartwarming, gripping, funny, and emotional. It had a bit of everything and the fact it was based on a true story made it even better. Importantly, it corrects history in a really effective way.Has instantly become my favourite performance and role of Willem Dafoe. He was great. Julianne Nicholson was excellent as his gentle, kindhearted wife. Diesel's performance as Togo should also ensure he join the likes of Benji in the dog-acting hall of fame. The film really excels at making the viewer feel as if Togo was their own - while also reminding viewers of every loyal dog they've ever had in life.The cinematography and scenery was breathtaking - literally. Has been a while since a film made me feel so cold! It's both a beautiful (and sometimes brutal) film to watch. The ice scenes were a definite standout.Togo is the perfect film to watch with your dog. In 2011, Time Magazine listed Togo as the most heroic dog of all-time. That should be enough for anyone to watch this excellent Disney film. Hopefully this is a sign of good things to come for Disney Originals!

reviews.review_title: Enjoyable in its honesty and simplicity.
reviews.content:
Heartwarming and enjoyable narration of a true story of courage and love where the protagonist is a dog.
The plotline is simple and straightforward yet engaging and thrilling enough. The characters development is interesting and thoughtful and helps in delivering a satisfying finale. Overall a watchable movie especially recommended to the younger humans who might enjoy its simplicity, pacing and characters.

reviews.review_title: Now we all know the truth
reviews.content: Togo stars Willem Dafoe & Julianne Nicholson it tells the life story of a man named Leonhard Seppala and his sled dog Togo who in 1925 embarked on a dangerous sled run to receive serum vials for the Alaskan town of nome. A lot of people from the 90s know the story of balto through the animated movie from 1995, How revered as a hero for bringing the serum back. How he had statues dedicated to him in his honor. Togo reveals the truth of how the embark played out and how Togo played the biggest part in the journey we reaping none of the awards and praise. Willem Dafoe as Seppala gives a great performance and you really enjoy the bonding that him and Togo developed over the course of their lives. Togo is an emotional ride that has you fill for the characters the entire way knowing their story now it makes you happy to know that they finally get the recognization that they didn't receive back then.
What a beautiful film, funny, on the edge of ur seat, we cried so much, absolutely loved it! Still crying now whenever I think of it lol. Acting was superb and so gripping.

I can't handle dog movies or anything with pets unless it's Beverly Hills chihuahua. But I stumbled upon an article about Togo on Wikipedia the other day and my mind was blown. I visited my favorite website for wimps like me ( does the dog die dot com) and verified it was a "safe" choice. Now since I knew the historical ending I felt confident, but this movie still was exhilarating and terrifying. The last scene was one of the most beautiful scenes. It happened to tear down all my walls and so I cried. Okay. I cried. Dang Disney. Making me feel things like emotions.

No Spoilers:
I had tears come to my eyes several times watching this heart-warming adventure across the beautiful Alaskan landscape of ice and snow. The soundtrack was quite moving. The two main actors' (NIcholson & Dafoe) performances were perfect. Luckly the dogs don't talk; you never know with Disney. So it stayed real and sincere. Best dog-sled movie I've ever seen. Lots of exciting moments of danger and hope. There's some rather smart dialogue too. I totally recommend this movie.

Even though Disney has been releasing a few gems over the last few years, it's really no secret that they're having a blast making money on their classics. Whether it's continuing Toy Story or making tons of live-action versions of their animated films, audiences, although flocking our to see them, don't seem to be all that impressed. With the exception of their franchise in The Marvel Cinematic Universe, I really can't see a new franchise blossoming for them anytime soon, unless you count the fact that they now own Avatar. My point is that it's always nice to see them take on an original film and Togo is their latest live-action original to be released, but this time by their streaming service, Disney Plus. Is it worth watching? Absolutely.Without giving anything away for those who haven't heard the real story, Togo tells the opposing story to Disney's 1995 film Balto. Known as the 1925 serum run, Togo follows Leonhard Seppala (Willem Dafoe) and his sled dogs as they travel through impossible conditions to retrieve medicine for a hospital with dying children. This is the core premise of the movie, but it's also equally about the bond between owner and dog. This film will have fans of both animals and drama tearing up. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience with this movie.Although it doesn't do anything new for films like this, it adds a depth of emotion that most of them are devoid of. Willem Dafoe, although not giving an award-winning performance by any means, remains committed from beginning to end. I found myself attached to these dogs, due to the love that was very clearly coming off of him. On top of that, there are some great visuals for a film that wasn't released in theatres. Disney Plus is clearly trying to release some quality content on their streaming service.In the end, Togo is a great film to watch with families around the holidays, so I believe those who have subscribed to their service will be enjoying this one very much this year. For the classics, Star Wars and Marvel content, I can definitely recommend signing up for this service, but I believe purchasing a month of this service just for this movie will even make you happy. It's a great feel-good story, even though it does delve into some sad elements. There's not much else to say about this movie. It's very well-made and emotionally satisfying. I absolutely recommend checking it out.

Well me and my wife were selecting a movie from Disney+ to watch and she randomly told me to select this one since it had a Dog's picture on the poster, and she loved dogs. Little did we know we were watching such an incredible movie that is so touching.
If you are a dog lover, I bet you won't be able to finish it without shedding tears

reviews.review_title: Very moving. I really enjoyed it!!!
reviews.content: I decided to watch this movie because of William Dafoe. I've always been a fan of his performances. This movie is very gripping from the beginning. For myself personally, I love a "real life" movie. I liked the pace and the story telling and how it would do flash backs and explain the characters. I never knew the true story of the 1925 Serum run to Nome Until watching this. I've heard of Balto before but never Togo. I was pleasantly surprised that this movie was almost 100% accurate to the real life events. Very enjoyable movie!

Best film of 2019 for me. Togo was just a beautiful film and William Defoe is such a great actor. The closing narrative was beautiful because it was William Defoe telling the story of Togo last years which he fulfilled his destiny. I cried throughout the whole film because it was just wonderful. The cinematography in this film was amazing. You have to watch this film.

Yes, 10/10. I guess it's because I'm so emotional.
I really enjoyed this movie. No - it's not mind blowing, and yes, we know this is a Disney movie, so the ending I predictable.
But Willem Dafoe is a brilliant actor.
If you like hachiko, you'll probably like this movie too.
Basically it's a story about the bond between a man and his dog.
And yes, the dialogue is primary willem dafoe yelling "good dogs" "come on puppies", but that's okay, because they are good dogs.All in all - a cute movie. For me it was two hours well spent.

Many dog stories been watched and most of the time is "so cute", "adorable" feeling. But this one is telling the life of a hero dog and showing its humanity side. Such movie should show in China, dog is not just man best friend but more than that. Stop eating dogs pls.
Someone told me if I watched it it would make me cry. So I didn't watch it

Someone wrote a review and mentioned that Togo is the best dog movie ever, I agree with that! Gosh this movie moved my soul and every fiber in me. Be prepared to cry and laugh when seeing this movie. This movie is all about love, friendship, never giving up, helping others and dedication and more. A movie for all ages. There are such beautiful scenes in the movie and you will feel so much love watching Togo.
I have never heard about this story, the story about Togo. Such a cool story and a brave dog. This movie made me love dogs even more.
I will never forget this movie. One of the best movies I have seen in my life.

After watching the trailer, I'm excited to watch this movie. When the film was released, and I'm started to watch, I'm telling myself, "Why this movie not released in the theatre?" It was a fantastic experience to watch Togo.It's a heartwarming and thriller. Cinematographer Ericson Core has done his best job in this movie. Cinematography and CGI are the best part of the Disney+ Togo movie.The way the director Ericson Core wanted to connect the entire story with us and he was successful in it. You will also become a little emotional while watching this movie. Willem Dafoe has done his best performance in the role of Seppala.You have to watch a Togo movie for a new adventure, thriller, and inspirational experience.

Amazing true story, cute dogs, on-the-edge-of-your seat adventure, beautiful cinematography and a great cast - not the least of which is the amazing dog cast members. I swear our dog Lucy is part of the Togo line - a total demon dog with a heart of gold...... Viewers keep in mind there is little fabrication in this story - incredibly it represents the true events.....

reviews.review_title: A wholesome, heartwarming and inspiring movie
reviews.content: I have developed a strong allergy towards Hollywood movies. They usually are soulless, depraved and filled with political messages.This one really stands out though. It's simply a beautiful, suspenseful, heartwarming story about a special dog and his master overcoming near impossible odds to save a town full of sick children from a deadly disease. Willem Defoe does a wonderful job. The lady who plays his wife as well, such a likeable character. And who doesn't love dogs?It's a rarity these days, a movie for the whole family. Enjoy it!

I absolutely loved this movie. How very moving, I cried some tears. What a fabulous story about that gorgeous dog Togo. And Willem Dafoe was as fantastic as always. I can highly recommend this gem of a movie.

Like most reviews here this movie is absolutely amazing and will keep viewers entertained and on the edge of their seats all the time, so unfortunate this incredibly wonderful dog didnt get the recognition he deserved.Must watch movie!!10/10

I don't usually like animal movies. They are all the same. If you've seen one you've seen them all; and yet, somehow Togo grabbed me by the heart. The dogs seem artificial, but that doesn't matter, for Disney-Illuminati succeeds in grabbing you by the heart... As it did with me. Bravo.

This simply was an amazing film, from start to finish, beautifully shot, acted, directed and produced.. I could not fault it in anyway..The sheer will and determination of these beautiful dogs goes beyond belief..Based on true events, It's unfortunate that Togo did not get the recognition he so rightly deserved but it was never about that.. the distance Togo and his team covered, of 264 miles, compared to an average of just 31 miles from the other teams, in those conditions was truly unbelievableI was heartbroken at the end, myself, a fully grown man was brought to tears by this film.. but I'm glad he got to live out his life happy and peacefully..I would recommend this film, for you just to see what they achieved is enough..

reviews.review_title: Good cinematography. One dimensional characters and little excitement.
reviews.content: Can't believe all the good scores. It makes no sense or they're false. Sure, the dogs were strong and full of passion but the writer completely left out the stories of the doctor, other racers, families who lost children and much more. I'm very familiar with this story and have read two books on this event. This is basically schlock and meant for the very young viewer, 6 - 10 year old. Adults will be incredibly bored. The writer started off by putting us in the middle of the epidemic and then did flashbacks to catch us up with the heroes. That's lazy writing in my opinion. I couldn't watch it. Turned it off.

The outdoor elements and effects were amazing and suspenseful. The cast - human and dogs - were fantastic. This is based on a true story and it's a tearjerker at times. Def. recommend for older kids and adults.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies of the year
reviews.content: Great for the whole family from start to finish. What CALL OF WILD should have been with real dogs. Outstanding!

I am at loss of words.
I love stories like this, one where we can watch with kids and make them learn a thing or two about life.
Togo is one in a million.

Disney just epitomized it, that too all in epic proportions, with #Togo.
What an incredible movie about the most spectacular, heroic animal of all time, who unfortunately didn't come under the limelight until the 21st century !!
Nevertheless, the base of the movie is of "Herculean" stature displaying the ardous, yet a life saving, "feel-good" journey that every sensible being will feel.
Direction, performances(from both the human and the animal) are impressive, while its the cinematography that stand's out in this project. Beautiful scenic beauty captured and shown which added life to the characters and the journey and thanks to #Hollywood for building these kind of inspiring films for the audiences.
Lastly, huge accolades and love to the dogs(especially the Lead) for characterizing the originals and displayed with such ease and with pure animal instincts.P.S : These kind of movies should be witnessed in the BIG screens for the optimum satisfaction
I thought this film would be a kids PG nonsense from DISNEY true story or not. But oh boy was I wrong. This is a story of hardships and endeavors against the odds for everyone involved in it.
If you are lucky enough to have known a great one,they never really leave.They stay with you as long as you live,harnessed to your heart,giving their all.Always

reviews.review_title: I haven't been able to stop crying!
reviews.content:
This incredible movie triggered in me a almost emotional breakdown.. i never thought i could could get so emotional over a film and it's very unnerving because I haven't been able to shake off the sadness and it's affected my health to the point where I got to be very careful or I'm I wind up going to ER.
I believe that knowing it's a true story made it even more impactful. but I am so glad that that credit is given now where it's due.
Willem Dafoe and Julianne Nicholson did a great job and especially the puppy who played the main part of Togo.
I've always been a Willem Dafoe fan but with this film he's really cemented as one of my all-time favorites now.
So please folks be prepared for an emotional rollercoaster of a film but don't let that stop you from watching it it is one of the top 2019 films that I've seen and I highly recommend it
Visually fantastic. dog acting brilliant. Story great. Lump in the throat what more can you say . Loved it

reviews.review_title: The best animal movie of all time
reviews.content: Its so saddening to know that because of the ongoing lockdown allover the world,the movie did not do well in the theaters. The less number of reviews of this brilliant movie is a proof of that.But after watching this movie, I am sure this is going to be a cult animal movie in the days to come.The cinematography is breathtaking to say the least. The acting, direction, script everything is just superb. Willem Dafoe as always shines in the male protagonist's role. And the dog as Togo, the most heroic animal of all time is extraordinary. Take some tissues with you as you may not have dry eyes towards the end. In my opinion =, this is one of the finest movies of this year and perhaps the best animal movie alongside Hachi. Please do not miss this masterpiece.

reviews.review_title: I never thought I'd find a perfect movie...
reviews.content: Simply put, I wouldn't change a thing about this movie. From begging to end this movie is perfect.The way that it is told (with flashbacks to Togo's early days) is perfect - and that's considering that I initially found it strange that they started near the end of the dog's life.Somehow, not seeing Togo grow up from the get-go or living with him through his life's struggles just made the story that much more impact-full. I think it's because they said just enough about his past to leave the rest of his character to the imagination, making everyone's opinion the dog the correct opinion.I was desperate that they did not spoil the film with a poor ending but Disney hit a home run with this one. The ending is on point, beyond my mist wistful dreams!Great job, Disney!

Does anyone actually believe that this happened the way they showed it? I hate when Hollywood exaggerates actual events. The scenes on the ice were just laughable.It just didn't live up to the hype as the emotional film between a man and his dog. I didn't buy any of the stuff Togo did as a pup. Wayyyyy too smart for what they showed. It was just poorly written. They could have focused on other things to make it stronger. Too many shots of the dogs running and the scenes became too repetitive. The acting didn't help either. I'm so tired of Hollywood actors forcing expressions and words to manipulate the audience should feel. Let the audience decide how we should feel by just showing the story. People in real life don't behave like that unless they are kids or liars trying to manipulate someone.Togo was more annoying than anything for them to have kept him. Besides they showed no reason why he would keep running back to them. Why?Too bad. In the right hands, it could have been right.

Togo is the untold true story of Sleddog legend Leonhard Seppala and his runt turn lead sled dog, Togo. In 1925, Sepp and Togo were apart of a serum run across central and northern Alaska and were never given credit for it. The film's storyline is well written the setting is perfect the theme music great. Cast staring Willem Dafoe (Sepp) and Julianne Nicholson (Constance Sepp), that chemistry was fluent. Diesel (Togo) was the perfect dog for this film, the resemblance is remarkable. It took ninety-five years for Togo to get his credit that due to him.

reviews.review_title: If you love dogs, you'll love this movie. If you don't love dogs, you'll still love this movie.
reviews.content: My only gripe with Disney is that they decided this was not worthy of the big screen. It was the most heartwarming movie of 2019, and i enjoyed watching this more than any movie i watched this year in the cinemas. I really hope Disney would reconsider releasing this in cinemas. It is sweet, emotional & family-friendly. Watch it with your family at home.

Mid way through this movie I had to call my dog over and hug him, this movie is shot brilliantly. The emotions you feel are raw and real and it was absolutely amazing. I have a couple complaints with this movie, mainly the movie has some pacing issues. The movie cuts between Togo being a puppy and Togo being an adult. Togo as a puppy is all "fun and games" and Togo as an adult is always high stakes. The movie feels like it is arranged weirdly. This movie is pretty darn good though. not quite an 8 out of ten for me, but a solid strong 7.5/10.

reviews.review_title: Abuatiful film about a beutiful dog.
reviews.content: Well written, beautifully shot and perfectly cast. This is time well spent.

reviews.review_title: Balto Schmalto. Togo is the true hero
reviews.content: What a magnificent story and a wonderful film. Thank you Disney for making this rare gem of a movie. This will be a movie that I will be happy to watch again and share with others.

I'm surprised I liked this movie as much as I did. I'm typically a harsh critic when it comes to film, but I literally cannot realize any part of this film that I did not like. It was funny, sad, heartwarming, and intense. The acting was really spot on, and all of the visuals were stunning.It was a little funny/curious watching Dafoe take on a more serious role (since I've only ever watched him as the Green Goblin LOL).

reviews.review_title: Given the fact that I'm a dog person
reviews.content: Given the fact that I'm a dog person, it would be strange if I didn't like this movie. Why hide it, at the end there was a lump in my throat, although I didn't get to those waterfalls that flowed after watching "Hachiko" (both times, by the way). As a dedication to the amazing brotherhood of man and dog; as a tribute to an animal that lived all these years in the shadow of Balto, although it deserved much more honors; as a love letter to our four-legged friends and as a beautiful Disney adventure for the whole family, the film is an undeniable success. Therefore, only a certain amount of critical masochism compels me to write the second paragraph. For a story about the full danger of traveling through a blizzard to save the lives of dozens of children, "Togo" seemed surprisingly boring to me. Despite the entertaining shooting technique, the action scenes as such did not work out. The music of Mark Isham also failed, as if on purpose to dilute any tension as much as possible with life-affirming melodies. The script still couldn't start, interrupting the whole narrative at first with cute, but then frankly protracted flashbacks, and then suddenly it somehow took off and ended. There was no big finale, no turning point, no heroes frozen on the edge of the abyss, no last spurt to victory. The quest to save precious lives somehow smoothly slid into the drama that started it all, and I went to put the kettle on, realizing that there was still half an hour left before the end of the film. While Willem Dafoe gleefully displays all of his Oscar-nominated dramatic abilities, the film isn't named after him, after all.

The best of Disney and what I grew up watching. I absolutely loved this movie. My son did too. This is what made Disney famous. I watched many Disney movies like this with my grandpa as a chil and teen and I'm great full I got to see such a flick with my boy. This is what America was built on... tough love and hard work but with love and compassion. Great jog Disney!!
Thank you to the team, thank you Mr Defoe, when the heart of a dog takes away that of a man, this movie is marvel, Togo the king of dogs ! Incredible story.

Waw, this is a must see movie in these times of Covid. So warm, touching your heart and emotions. Once you realize this is a true story, it's even more amazing as you really can't believe the events actually happened bginning of the 1900. Although Togo did a fantastic job, the scene on the ice was terrifying well done, he did not got the credit. It was Balto. But in our hearts, Togo stays the best dog: ever !
Unbelievable performance of Willem Dafoe. Please, watch the movie with your kids. It is worthwhile your time
Boring film, no depth, it's a film for children. Nice photography through.Note: Ratings in Disney movies are definitely cheated.

What a movie. A must watch emotional journey. It shows the truth friendship between a human and a dog. The loyalty, the love the trust. As for William dafoe i have no words!!!!!! He is truly amazing for one more time!

reviews.review_title: The best leaders are like this, with their own ideas and persistence.
reviews.content: A dog that is not looked upon, just because he refuses to be domesticated. However, the best leaders are like this, with their own ideas and persistence. Norton Bay where the sea ice burst is too exaggerated and unreal. This is the biggest failure of the whole film. The screen filter is very warm, imitating the image of the wild era in the 1925s. The heroes behind the scenes are really great. The lovely Norwegians and their reliable Alaskan Snow Dogs. I also want to find a Belgian beauty as a wife.

This is a Disney Live action Movie about a true story. This Story is set in 1925 in Alaska, there is an outbreak of Diphtheria that has the whole territory pinning there hopes on the cure arriving in time. The problem is that the serum is a 640 round trip from where they are. As the film begins you will see William Dafoe who plays the role of Leonhard Seppala, a MUSHER, and his dog team. The town pin their hopes on the fact that, Leonhard and his dogs will be able to not only overcome the length of the journey, but also the fact that the area is experiencing some of the worst storms on record. Leonhard's dogs are lead by Togo.As you see the team set of with the whole town out seeing them off and hoping that they can do a journey. Its a race against time. Can they make the Journey in time? Can they make it, there and back at all?During the journey the film takes you back 12 years to give you the background on how the team, well more Togo had developed. Here you will see Julianne Nicholson portray Constance Seppala (Leonhard's Wife). Now i'm not saying much except, he isn't like most of the dogs! you will seeExcellent work by Disney and a film i'm sure a lot of people will enjoy. Just to say the scenes on the lake are dramatic and well made
I was very impressed with the scenes of peril - the FX was very, very good! The story is a true one and it's exciting, emotional, and inspiring. The dogs are adorable.

This movie deserves 10 stars just because of its main star: the dog that played Togo. I mean, don't get me wrong; Dafoe delivered a compelling performance but I couldn't stop thinking how incredibly talented and emotive the dog actor was. Seriously. The dog actors and their trainers deserve so much credit for their roles in making this movie a successful one. I had an idea that the movie would end on a sad note and although it didn't really, I still wept. I don't know how much of the movie is CGI but the cinematography was beautiful; expansive and barren landscapes that made the snow dogs and its master look minuscule.

reviews.review_title: I dont know if I can describe what i felt...
reviews.content: This movie is amazing ! It is stunning. Willem Dafoe at his best!!! It is an unbelievably emotional and dramatic story based on a real story with a beautiful pack and its leader Togo. A survival emotional and motivational move that will touch your heart and WILL make you cry... Great narration through back and forth stories , pictures and directing is terrific! So beautiful. It will warm your heart and the speech inside is going to be memorable!
I cannot find one single imperfection in this movie, one single thing I would have changed, it's perfect.

reviews.review_title: Disney Plus Needs More Movies Like This!
reviews.content: Togo is about a guy who doesn't believe that this dog is a sled dog. He then try to have him be a sled dog and realizes how great he could be. Then he gets to thinking if his purpose is something else.This movie isn't advertised at all. The first thing I saw of it was a small little advertisement in the corner of the IMDb page. I think if they told more people it was coming, maybe some more people would have bought Disney plus. I bet many dog lovers would love this movie and from what I have seen, critics have also been saying it is pretty solid. I have to say I like it too. These are the type of movies Disney needs to put on their streaming channel. From what I remember they might too! I thought William Dafoe gave a pretty solid performance. I always thought people under looked him as an actor but I have been starting to realize that many people enjoy watching him in films. All of the other actor did a great job in this picture. In my mind, it was just William Dafoe with a bunch of dogs. For the whole runtime of the film I was always in aw while looking at the ice breaking, or the snow covered mountains, or even just a patch of trees. It looked really beautiful. It looked like someone went out into Alaska and took pictures of a bunch of mountains, ice, and trees. That is how great it looked. I thought the lighting wasn't the best. It was pretty dark and at some scenes hard to see. There were also some flashbacks that pretty much came out of nowhere. In my mind, those were small problems.Overall, I really enjoyed watching Togo. I would recommend it if you have Disney Plus at the moment.
When I was little I watched the cartoon movie Balto, I felt bad when I watched Togo, because Togo was the real hero and he didn't get recognized... Better late than never...Loved the movie ❤
Wow...what a fantastic beautiful film about the best very good boy who has ever lived.Just make sure you have some tissues handy.The last five minutes WILL GET TO YOU

This movie captured my attention from the very first 5 min! The cinematography was superb, the story line was moving and had so much depth throughout its entirety. I Strongly recommend this movie to everyone. Also William Defoe was magnificent as usual! I give this a 10/10 with much ease and no hesitations whatsoever.

This was an interesting piece of history to watch. At first I thought this movie may blend right in with all the other sleds dog films, but the personality of Togo really brought a new life to this storyline. Though the story itself seemed a bit flat, and the characters were very shallow, Togo's focus kept my interest throughout the movie. I really thought the flashbacks were a nice touch throughout the film as it broke up the journey to tell the whole story inbetween. Despite what I said about the characters falling a little flat, I'm glad the main focus was on shaping Togo's character and personality, as he was the hero of the story.

reviews.review_title: This would be a better book than movie! Bored
reviews.content:
The story is not for the cinema. The end was obvious since the beginning. Many cliches. You know how story will continue. I got bored most of the time knowing what's gonna happen next.
It doesn't deserve 8imdb point. I have two dogs and I love dogs and the story of this dog is very touching but this movie ? No! It's an average movie

This was such a touching movie. I'm so grateful to the authors of the screenplay bringing the true story of Togo to the theaters. It's great to see a correcting of historical accounts to ensure that credit goes where credit is due. Willem Dafoe does an amazing job and that dog is absolutely gorgeous. I'm somewhat biased as I own three Siberian Huskies myself and they are my joy. This movie created such a wonderful feeling of that bond between man and dog and combined it with an incredible story filled with action and heart. Just loved it.
I rarely give a 10 but the acting, scenery and story (even though it's a simple one)came together in a beautiful and moving way. All animals are amazing, but dogs are a gift to the world.

reviews.review_title: Great adventure film for adults and children
reviews.content: My wife and I both loved this film. Great adventure, glorious scenery and based on a true story. More movies like this please!Interestingly an end note explains that not Togo, but another dog Balto, got all the adulation, and a statue is dedicated to him in Central Park. Had me all upset that Togo did not get the praise he deserved but then I thought "well, he's a dog so what does he care?" I guess the fact that I cared so much goes to show how well the movie was made.
Not bad not great, but worth checking out. I really liked the cinematography. Wasn't a tear jerker like everyone is saying, but definitely a heart warming story.

A movie about a misbehaving mutt of a work dog. You know what they do to misbehaving work dogs? This is just more Disney garbage trying to tug at heart strings. Same as The Art of Racing in the Rain. Designed to tug at the heartstrings of the ignorant.And once again, all the 10/10 reviews you see are coming from new users with only one review on their account...

Definitely give this one ago you will not regret it.
Amazing acting, William Dafoe is perfectly cast and the story is brilliant.

reviews.review_title: Moving story of the most courageous!
reviews.content: Togo made me cry! This movie is a gem for a dog lover and if you don't love dogs, you will know why they are loved! Togo had the heart of a survivor and his love for his leader was unconditional. Truly a man's best friend!

reviews.review_title: Togo walked so Balto could run...
reviews.content: If you don't have Disney+, you should get it just to watch this movie. I loved everything about it. It had humorous moments, triumphant moments, and moving moments. All you could want in a feature film. If you're a lover of animals or history, this movie is a must!

Why this is not in cinemas globally is a shock.
The film is absolutely brilliant ..emotions galore.. ticks all the boxes. Classic heroic tale storyline and fabulous acting...it has it all. In my top 5 of 2019 for sure.. highly recommended..a must watch.

This is this type of movie that keeps Disney on top! We all ready knew the story but were on the edge of our seats with nervous expectaions for the entire movie! We need more like this, not the Hollywood crap that we are constantly seeing on the big screen!

reviews.review_title: From a former musher, I adore this movie.
reviews.content: Let me start by saying my family and I used to race sled dogs in Maine. I have researched this story. I am so thankful that this movie is here. It really portrays the truth of the story not the coverup that everyone was made to believe.The cinematography is absolutely stunning. The story is so heartwarming and action packed too. This movie is incredibly accurate from a mushers perspective. It really shows you want sled dogs are truly capable of. The flashbacks were fantastic and added so much more life to the movie. This movie is a masterpiece. I am so glad that it depicts the true heroes of the serum run- Togo and Leonard Seppala.
One of the best movies I have ever seen. Based on a true story it's just brilliant.

A well made and well acted film, but the star is Togo.I found this film to be a tear jerker as it strongly reminded me of my father's dog, Tim. Tim was an Australian kelpie (a sheep dog) and his bond with Dad was like in the film. He was devoted to Dad.Dad had firm views on his dogs and would not let us treat them as pets (no patting of dogs), and like in the film (no dogs in the bedroom) Dad's dogs were never allowed into our house. They were cared for and trained but not pampered at all.At one time Dad had to have major surgery and was away from the farm for weeks and when he returned he was bedridden for months. During that time Tim fretted and eventually stopped eating entirely. Mum was concerned and tried to coax Tim into the house to see Dad but Tim wouldn't enter the house. So my elder brother picked him up and carried him into my parent's bedroom. Dad was able to put his hand out of the bed and reassure Tim with a pat on his head. Tim licked Dad's hand and wagged his tail and then went straight outside and ate his food. Dad eventually recovered.Some dogs are amazing. But their lifespans are short so it is always difficult when they die.

reviews.review_title: What a beautiful film, great job Disney+
reviews.content: William Defoe does a great job, as well as the other cast, but the ones that really steal the show are the dogs, especially Togo, and this is his movie. The flashbacks work to make a coherent story and doesn't feel warned out, usually when a movie goes to the flashback or continues the story you sit there like UGH hurry so we can get back to the interesting stuff. But with this film they both hold big interest and has you glued to your screen. It takes a little for the movie to kick but once it does it really delivers. Hopefully Disney continues to make films as good as this if not better. Great movie!

reviews.review_title: Hatci the most loyal and Togo the fighter and the bravest ever
reviews.content:
A masterpiece like Hatchi:a dog's story
And it's even better
Great story and great actor
Great Directing
For me absolutely one of the best in 2019
Underrated movie

This movie was fantastic, from beginning to end. It was honest and powerful, with great performances from both the humans and the dogs. Dafoe in particular was excellent, as was Nicholson, as his wife. Epic performances for both. But the MVP award goes to the dogs who played Togo and his buddies. They were so sweet. Take down the statue in Central Park and PUT UP TOGO!!!
I find the frequent extended flashbacks disruptive to the flow and momentum of the story. Though the journey is heroic, it does not touch me as much as I expected.

When i watched the trailer i thought that Togo was going going to be just a average movie but i was wrong. It's a great movie which i never expected it to be.
Togo has a simple story but based on a true story of a incredibly brave dog (Togo) and his owner. The movies story runs around the Togo and it's owner played by Willem Dafoe who does proper justice to his role.
Most of the aspects of the movie is good. Specially the location and the cinematography.
Overall this movie is good. Far far more good than I thought.

We Praise Togo, The lead sled dog that saved thousands of children in the 1925 Serum Run in Nome, Alaska and got all of the credit stolen by Balto. Disrespectful, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THE MOVIE "TOGO" ON DISNEYPLUS.

reviews.review_title: Togo The best dog ever lived.
reviews.content: A beautiful relationship between the dog and human. What a brave dog. The Togo. My heart was pumping so fast the whole time. Love this movie.

reviews.review_title: If you own pets, you will cry
reviews.content:
Loved this film. All the lead characters are superbly cast, including the dogs.
The fact it is a true story just adds to the emotion of what must have been a harrowing journey for all them.
A must watch
Willem Dafoe is brilliant as always. This movie is not only accurate and sweet but it's still a movie you can watch with the kids.

Made me want to get one!Perfect movie! Reminded me of the feeling I got when I watched the movie Sounder as a young child which was played in our school auditorium. Nice feeling!Perfect Christmas Movie!

reviews.review_title: So Glad I Got Disney Plus For My Grandchildren...
reviews.content: Because Togo is definitely worth the channel! At my age, I grew up with Disney movies and parks. Togo is, absolutely, a throwback to the great movies made when Walt Disney was CEO of the studio. Willem Dafoe was a perfect choice to play the lead character and Julieanne Nicholson was absolutely wonderful as his wife. Togo is a movie based on a true story about the Diptheria outbreak in Nome, Alaska, in 1925 and the dog sled race to get medicine from another city 600 plus miles away back to Nome to save the children of this small town. This movie has so much heart and soul, it's a rare gem in the movie world today.In reality, it's about the love between a man and his dog that takes twelve years to discover. I loved everything about Togo. The acting, the humor, the scenery, the cinematography, the directing, the heart, and especially the dogs used to portray these sled dogs of the 1920s in Alaska were of the highest degree I have seen in a long time. Because of Togo's age (12) and the difficulties of the trip that ended up being almost 300 miles in the middle of one of the worst storms ever seen up to that time in the area they had to travel, the very last leg of the Journey was run by a dog named Balto, who was nationally hailed as the hero of the Journey. In reality, it was Togo who saved the children with his amazing strength and love of his man, but was too ill to make the final run to Nome.I have had and loved and lost many wonderful dogs in my lifetime, so I admit that I cried nonstop in the last 15 minutes of this movie. But be aware, the ending isn't as sad as I thought it would be. It was absolutely a perfect ending to a perfect story in a perfect movie. I would give this movie a 15 if it went that high. One of my top 20 favorite movies I have seen in my lifetime. To say I highly recommend it, is an understatement. You can now bundle Hulu and Disney Plus together and save $7 a month, which is what we did as a gift for my daughter's family for Christmas. However, I have already watched more of the movies and shows on Disney than they have at this point. Do yourselves a favor and watch this wonderful movie. There is nothing boring or whatever negative thing I read in a couple reviews here at all. If you have a heart, you will love this movie!!
Absolutely brilliant heartfelt film, amazing acting the real star of the show is Togo, a must family see movie

Im so happy Togo got his own movie. Growing up watching Balto I never knew the story of Togo sadly. Im so glad to know of him now and I'll keep him and Seppala in my thoughts and prayers and remember their contributions to the world. The movie is fantastic please check it out!
This is the best movie for me in 2019. Nothing to say. It's perfection. Thankyou disney, thankyou Dafoe

"Harnessed to your Heart". Such a beautiful film with a wonderful performance by Willem Dafoe, who plays Leonhard Seppala, who raised Huskies in the Alaskan Wilderness. History tells us of the great serum run in 1925, but Balto was the dog honored on the last leg, the final 55 miles, and that's the one remembered. Within that run was a 264 mile round trip led by a dog considered too small and too old to do the job. But, Seppela knew otherwise, hence the basis for the film Togo about a forgotten dog that Time Magazine called the 'greatest animal hero of all time'(2011). Shot in a way to give us the loneliness of that era is the story of frustration with a mischievous puppy that turns into an incredible bond of love and loyalty. Dafoe is in his element here with a character that plays to both strengths and weaknesses. Add to that a subtle but haunting score from Mark Isham and guarantee you will be in tears by the time Seppala says the words "harnessed to your heart". A monumental achievement for Disney +.

reviews.review_title: Thankful to my life to watch this
reviews.content: I've seen many dog-related movies in my life but I'm thankful that I got to see this one. And I also wish that the 'Bolto Statue' in the NYC park should be renamed after the true hero. I cried when Sepala recited his pups the 'inspiring verses' while crossing the river. There will be no other dog as loyal as Togo. He was not just a dog, he was more than a human.
If you love dogs and true stories of surviving.. this is your movie

reviews.review_title: I'm gonna throw my Balto movie away!
reviews.content: So this is based on the real story of The 1925 serum run to Nome. I loved the 1995 animation movie Balto but I'm going to take that out of my dvd collection! I was so upset to see Balto got all the credit for the amazing work Togo did!Great movie if you like animals and believe in great friendships between all living things watch this. The lives we take for granted. The strenght of companionship. You don't own animals, we live side by side with them. To grow a strong heart. I'm a cat person but I also love dogs.

I loved the older live action Disney's films like Huck Finn, Iron Will, Rocketeer, and many others. I miss these types of films. I feel that lots of the live action Disney films today pay to much focus is on CG, animation, super hero's and princess films. Finding this film on Disney plus was truly a breath of fresh air. Togo is a film of the same caliber of days past when the focus of a story was heart, adventure and a feel of reality. I love that it is also an untold true story that needed to be told. I love that it was clean and worthy of family viewing without any awkward scenes that kids and parents uncomfortably glance at each other. Well done!

reviews.review_title: I think I have dust in my eyes
reviews.content:
Truth be told, last month I had to put my furball down so this movie hit me a lot harder than it probably would have under normal circumstances.
