It's not the sadness of death because that is inevitable; but the sadness of missing THAT companionship. The companionship that many develop with their furry friend. The companionship that is shown in Togo. Even the guilt that Willem character feels when Togo looks like he might not make it brings back guilt felt afterwards.
This is a wonderfully shot film with beautiful shots of Alaska and the serenity and brutality of the Alaskan wilderness during the 1920's. There were times where it looked like it was a painted backdrop or the green screen CGI looked off. I don't know how much of this version of the story of Togo is true but if it did happen; there's a legitimate reason why this dog, companion, friend, was celebrated throughout Alaska and the sled dog world.
A great movie for the family

Marathoning all Disney films that are based on real events, sad for this synopsis, forcing a puppy to pull a sled as if it were a heroic act ... I withdraw what I said, it was not just sport, he saved the children from Diphtheria , some situations and facts have been altered and exaggerated, but since Disney is making cute films, we do the same...

Flawless CGI with a beautiful story based on real events. A nice couple with a persistent sled dog that got into an intense race (you can get immerse into the emotions) to safe a lot of kids. The movie played with my emotions and kept my full attention.
Watched it with the 7 and 16yr olds and wow, as dog owners, this was an absolute treat in every way.

Very touching true story about Togo, an amazing, legendary hero. Much respect to Willem Dafoe who really put his heart into this role. This movie is not unlike the classic Disney movies of the 1960's (only better!). Highly recommend.

reviews.review_title: Wonderful story, too much like a Hollywood blockbuster
reviews.content:
Very sad that as much as I am absolutely crazy about dogs, and had looked forward to watching an inspiring film, I just found that the seemingly endless sledding by Willem Dafoe just too far-fetched to be believable. All the constant cracking of the ice (hooray for CGI) as he and his dog team raced across the bay was so CGI-overladen that it positioned itself alongside the plethora of like films which over-use CGI to such an extent as to lose all sense of realness. Especially the scene where the lead dog Togo stop inches away from a huge precipice after an out-of-control rush down an implausibly steep mountainside, this was just so unreal(istic.
Odd also that throughout the hour or so I watched of the film not once did Dafoe feed his dogs, which seems a huge error.
The obvious play of emotion using children likely to die of diphtheria was again so Hollywood, and let's face it there are few films out of Hollywood which approach anything like believable. FIlms of course are about imagination, creativity, adventure, etc, but instinct tells me before the words come into my head that a film is just not crafted well enough so as to persuade me and carry me along in its
story.
Sad that a great, inspirational story didn't attract the right director who could have honoured it by making an inspiring, believable film.

reviews.review_title: I am elated that this story is being told on the silver screen.
reviews.content: Togo deserves the recognition. From my research most of what is in the film is very factual and true to the real Togo. Please, watch it with the family.

To follow Togo on his journey to get the medication for his village. How he led a team of dogs running the longest way and fighting the cold weather.Since I was a kid I have read and seen the movie Balto and had always believed it was him that did the long run, but according to this movie, he only finished the last 31 miles while Togo needed to rest as he was old and has run for 200+ miles. I loved this movie and I was hooked right away and could bit look away or pause the movie at all. I have watched it a few more times and I am still hooked as the first time.

Stunning visuals with exceptional performance from the cast and especially the dogs. The approach of inserting flashbacks were chosen which gave a strong case for character development but sacrificed strong direction and captivating story-telling. Missed opportunities for dramatic scenes that can get the audience further into the heroic moments of Togo. Nonetheless, a strong movie with emotional moments given by a remarkable performance from Diesel and Willem Dafoe.

This was an absolutely amazing story of the serum race of 1925. Togo was an amazing dog and the life he had with his owner was a truly extraordinary bond between human and animal. Although someone else mistakenly got the credit for the serum delivery Togo remains the hero of this story now and forever. This movie is a must watch for animal lovers ÷specially for those of you that love dogs.

What a great movie! excellent acting by William dafoe,great Alaska shots and just overall a very moving story!
Our family loved it

If you love dogs like i do this movie won't dissapoint you. Gorgeous animals, breathtaking places, action and adventure...excellent acting and a very enchanting uplifting story that happens to be a true piece of history.A complete joyful time to share with family and friends.
What an incredible story. Hard to hold back tears when you imagine the bond some animals have with people. Fantastic acting from both humans and dogs alike. A must watch.
What a beautiful important story to tell and who better to do it. Learned so much. Amazing cinematography. Cried the last 15 minutes.

What a whirlwind of a movie with a great big heart. It is rare to find a movie about dogs where you care about the humans too. Willem Dafoe and Julianne Nicholson deliver great performance and you start to care about the couple for being such good caretakers of the dogs.All the stunts and performances by the dogs were convincing and great 12/10 good boys, deserve all the treats and tennis balls.If I had to nitpick it would be for the cgi during the ice sheet break scene. But apart from that, the score, music, sound design, costume, make up everything was so good. Every shot was beautiful Alaskan landscape captured masterfully plus the editing was tight.Highly recommend family movie.

Balto, imma let you finish, but Togo had the greatest sled run of all time! ¯\_(**)_/¯Wilem Defoe is great. His wife in the movie was a little awkward. This movie started a little slow for me but picked up a lot of speed. Incredible story, and they definitely set the record straight.

My girlfriend loves dog movies so, naturally, she insisted we watch this. It was great to see her audibly coach the dogs through each perilous scene and giggle every time Togo was disobedient. The movie itself is okay. As with any movie, Willem Dafoe is the best part. It's cute and the intense emotional scenes work fine. It's a little bland looking. Everything is dark blues or faded oranges. Depth of field in the beginning scenes felt a bit strange as the borders of the frame were out of focus. Clearly an intentional choice, but it's not one I really liked.That's about it. Nothing else to see here. If your partner wants to watch a cute dog movie with you just do it. It'll make them happy.

We were promised movies like Frozen - 2, Star wars which were nothing short of disappointment. And then there are movies like these that never get that many promotional platforms but are the cream of the crop.The movie has every element to make you feel your money and time's worth. Scenes are breathtaking and thrilling at the same time. And you will absolutely fall in love with your pet all over again.Has to be one of the best movies of the year 2019. Do not miss it!

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies I've ever watched.
reviews.content: I very seldom watch a movie twice but Togo I did. I gave it a 10 the first time but I gave it a 10+ this time. This is one of the most heart warming movies I've ever seen. Some of the scenes were absolutely amazing. If you're not a dog lover, watch Togo and you will certainly be a dog lover by the end.

I enjoyed this from start to finish. It isn't overly sentimental, which is the norm for this type of Hollywood Disney movie, and is all the better for it. The scenery is terrific and the special effects pretty good, and with Willem Dafoe in the cast you can't really go wrong. Definitely recommended.

Can't believe it took so long fir this story to be put straight
But yes it's was a special movieBest dog movie I ever seen tbh
Loved it
This movie is absolutely perfect . Brilliant dogs, actors, direction, just beautiful family film.
This is kind of movie I didn't want to come to an end. Mind-blowing background music

reviews.review_title: A must see for any nature lover
reviews.content: A true masterpiece. Exceptional true story, magnificent landscapes. Amazing dogs and Willem Dafoe at his very best !

reviews.review_title: Animals are abused by human being
reviews.content: Human always thinks they are the better species and they deserve to use other species as tools or eat them as food. They are right, the strong ones always take control of the weaker ones. That's how did the world work, but what makes me sick is this film shows some scenes that the main character is abusing the dog. This is so sad because I have seen enough in real life, now I can't even have a break while watching the movie and trying to relax. Disney couldn't even make a dog film right and that's a big shame for them.

Interesting story but the script is poor and the whole movie is a collection of unrealistic CGI...unrealistic scenes...ice lake ridiculous...the mountain climb looks like the final ascent on Everest. :)

I knew of the story in jest but not the true facts but after watching the movie with my better half we was just in awe...
Tremendous!Hits all the notes & don't over dramatise the actual events too where your on a roller coaster however to say the movie/story don't put you on an emotional ride is an understatement.Excellent Sunday afternoon watch

I was totally caught off guard by this movie!I can't specify what hit me, but I was in tears almost from beginning to the end. Both happy and sad tears.I have an aging dog myself. He's a 10 year old Ridgeback. And yes, he is my heart.I love my dog more than I can explain with words, and I make sure he knows it every day. That said, this masterpiece of a movie was like an emotional rollercoaster for 2 hours straight.There were so many things that touched me, but I couldn't specify what ir was... I constantly pictured my own dog in Togo, and that overwhelmed me.The movie makers have done a fantastic job showing how deep the love for an animal can be.My own dog has been limping a little the last few months. After weekly sessions with a chiropractor, physiotherapist and laser treatment, he is finally getting better.Seeing Togo limping at the end had the same effect as squeezing onion into my eyes.

The only thing that affected negatively to the strength of this movie is the sequence of its events.
Exiting the present to the past (during critical situation) has distracted the attention from focusing on the difficulty of that tough journey, from and to Nome.

One of the most telling stories I've seen recently ,
Be sure to watch this movie ,
When you find out it is based on a true story, it makes the movie worth more .

Shows a child-friendly, cute puppy story rather than the really tough survival drama. Therefore everyone in the audience will end up crying at the end.
Terrible color filter to hide the cheap CGI paired with bad layering.

As someone who was a huge fan of the film "Balto" as a young child, I was thrilled when I heard about the impending release of this movie. For a long time I've wanted a live-action, historically accurate film about the events of the serum run, and this did not disappoint!The plot of this movie mainly focuses on the life of Togo (hence the title) and his career as a sled dog, as well as his unparalleled devotion to his owner, Leonard Seppala, who doubted his abilities as a working dog during his earlier years. Togo received little recognition for the major role he played in saving Nome from the diphtheria epidemic, and this film spared no expense in showing us what sacrifices were made by both him and his musher to save the lives of others. On top of the strong emotions this movie makes you feel, it also delivers a bit of comedy which was unexpected, but very amusing!I couldn't help but feel nostalgic from the various "Balto" references, which weren't surprising since this is the same story. I was very impressed with the nod to the original film when they recreated the scene where the sled team had slid down a steep mountain slope, stopping themselves just before falling over the edge of a cliff. Balto makes a few cameo appearances towards the end, but more so for the purpose of "de-throaning" him by pointing out that he, by a twist of fate, ended up taking the credit for saving Nome when it had been mainly Togo (and over 100 other dogs) who all played an important role. By the end of the film, I was nearly tearing up because of how touching the final scene was as a tribute to Togo's life, as well as the epilogue and photo before the end credits.This movie made me laugh, it made me cry. It was the long-awaited re-telling of this remarkable story of the serum run we've needed for almost 100 years. Togo is finally recognized for the hero that he is. It is one of the best and bravest things that humans and animals have ever done!

reviews.review_title: one of the best films I have ever seen
reviews.content: Didn't know anything about it before watching; on the edge of my seat the entire time!!! It was funny, filled with love, adventure, and so much more. This is the best movie I have seen in a long, long time.

reviews.review_title: William Defoe spouting "good dogs", and it's sure to melt your heart!
reviews.content:
Togo is a character driven tale that focuses primarily on the central "man and his dog" tale rather than the wider race against time (and elements), and it's all the better for it. The film flits between present day and flashbacks, nicely building up the central bond between Seppala and Togo - recounting his mischievous puppy years in which the musher tried to give him away twice(!), to him finding his heroic place leading the pack. It's a beautiful bond that will undoubtedly melt the iciest of hearts; you know what they say about the purest love being between grumpy dads and the pets they said they didn't want!
Core brings the impressive feat of dog and human endurance to life with gorgeously sweeping wide shots framing the beautiful, but often deadly, vistas of Northern Alaska. The action was suspenseful and tense, coupled with an overwhelming use of icy blues and an endless white that transported you into the rough terrain. The only downside to the film was the at times small-screen feel about it, particularly when scenes took place in the towns.

The movie follows disney's depiction of the story about Leonhard Seppala and his Dog Togo.
The Story has a strong premise, but very little is told about the world behin it, so it falls apart over the action and emotion grabing story. An what is told has a romantic touch. there are some very staged scenes which stoped the plot ore took the viewer out of the film.
I mostly liked the start and the end, but sadly i read after watching the movie that the end was also romanticly enhanced.
It's clearly seen that they had to manage the production around a smaler budget, they did a solid job with that. And also William Dafoe always looks good and gives the character deepnes.

reviews.review_title: Mind blowing, touching, sincere, beautifully written, spectacular, great movie: TOGO
reviews.content: Absolutely amazing dog movie. This film will touch your heart deeply for the love of dogs, respect and great cast. Willem Defoe plays a very good role. Made me cry till the very end. Did not know the history of TOGO, now it's my favorite movie. Highly recommend.

Disney did not end the movie on the facts of Togo's end. But the story was about Togo's heroic effort. It's probably said to be a sad ending because Seppala gave him to Elizabeth. So they were separated for a long time and only reunited just before Togo's death. This was never showed in the movie. Not really a sad story, but definitely wasted potential for the movie, considering the Top tier actor named Willem Dafoe they hired for the main role, the euthanasia scene would've been so well delivered. After the serum run, i was definitely READY to get hurt. The real story is amazing & inspiration but in the move a lot of details missing.
You should all build Togo and other dogs a statue worthy of heroes.
The Wisconsinite showes why hes one of the greatest actors of our time..
I was laughing, stressed, anxious & cried my eyes out at the end. The movie was brilliant, William Defoe did the character great justice. The dogs especially Togo were true heroes. I loved it.

I see people who give this movie 3 stars or even just 1.
Everybody got his own opinion but 1 star for this movie is just redicuelous (excuse my english im from holland) i mean cmon the shots are great and also the story, You just cant give this movie 1 star , you make yourself look stupid. Ratings like this give a wrong image about a movie, i understand everybody is not the same and taste of movies can be different i know.
Believe me i have seen movies who deserves not even 1 star, but if you give this movie 1 star you just dont understand.

I appreciate the story telling. It had a lot of atmosphere, great filming and a nice Christmas like grunchy effect on the borders to give it that somewhat dreamy Christmas old style look, yet I could still not get immersed in it. It felt all a bit too straightforward in characters and pasted on emotions. The scene with the ice breaking on the river was also completely overdone and ruined it for me as well. It's just an entertaining movie with that very clear Disney flavor in top of it. It lacked anything that gave a sense of realism. It was all about that Disney emotion. In my view you then didn't do justice to the real story. It makes me even wonder how much of it is real. Not bad, but nothing special either. Nice Christmas movie though. For kids om sure they love this. A hero dog, who wouldn't love it. Too bad they couldn't add more character to it.
Great story,cast and effects. One of my favorites. Grab a popcorn and enjoy with your family.

Beautyfull shots, Great story, they used a unique effect of a "old" movie wich is great.
Saw this movie in dolby vision on a oled tv, that realy makes a big difference. But also without oled its a great story offcourse. its just shot so beautyfull that you need to see it in good quality.
Watched this movie on Christmas Day. An outstanding tale of courage and loyalty. The camera work is amazing. I urge you to watch this movie. Truly awesome!
Thnx for making a movie about this Beautiful story. Try to hold your tears ... 😊

The movie never fails to make you feel a part of the story. The story is undertold, and as one who loved Balto, feels this movie brings some much needed light to the original events that occurred. Perfectly cast, and paced well. Great film for all to enjoy!

This movie was incredible! Loved every minute of it....from the acting, to the incredible scenery, to the amazing dogs and a heartwarming true story! I was an absolute blubbering mess by the end of it 😭 This movie is a definite MUST see!!

For a Disney+ film I was anticipating something a lot more directed towards kids, and to be fair it's definitely one kids can enjoy. But Togo is definitely a film that can be enjoyed by anyone any age, a brilliant and accurate telling of the little-known story behind the more famous headlines. Willem Dafoe plays his part excellently, and is the perfect choice to chronical the changing emotions of this hard Norwegian. Aesthetically, the film is shot very well, and overall it delivers exactly what you may expect. An enticing, sentimental epic pulling at your heart strings right until the very end.

reviews.review_title: Very good, but uses an excessive amount of CGI
reviews.content: This movie uses more CGI than most action movies today.... there's seriously MINUTES of CGI used in the movie, and it's not good CGI either, it's very easy to see that it's CGI (and that's when you know that it's bad CGI). So I think the film could certainly have benefited from cutting WAY back on the CGI. It also would have made it so that MUCH of the $40million budget wasn't wasted on needless CGI... and perhaps that money could then have been spent on making the film slightly longer (which I think it would have really benefited from since the film actually ends very abruptly after the serum run is completed).But otherwise, it's a very good true-story movie and captures a pretty important historical moment during the diphtheria outbreak in 1925 Alaska. Willem Dafoe delivers some great acting throughout.Overall, it's a great true-story movie and certainly worth a watch. 8/10.

A great movie that opens up your eyes to one of the historic moment in Alaska's history and shines how dependent and reliable dogs have been in that icy cold terrain. This is a story of great bond between man and dog. Very beautifully depicted with very real effects. Your respect for sled dogs will increase by great extent .

reviews.review_title: A Edge of the Seat Movie

reviews.review_title: Terrific true story to set the record straight
reviews.content: True story of the incredible dogsled team lead by musher Leonhard Seppala and his lead dog Togo. Many dogsled teams participated in the 600+ mile relay to deliver serum to halt the Diphtheria epidemic of Nome Alaska in 1925, but only one of those teams traveled over 260 miles in sub-zero and often blizzard conditions. The most famous team was the one that actually delivered the serum, lead by Fox and Balto, the latter dog Balto of course receiving all the fame. This movie is a reminder that it was Seppala's team led by the incredible Togo that vastly outdistanced all of them.The film begins with the outbreak of the Nome epidemic with Togo an established and senior dog of 12 years old and uses flashbacks to recount his early years and all the trouble they had with this unruly, smallish but lightning fast and amazingly intelligent puppy. His destiny was to lead the sled team and lead it he did. Can anyone possibly imagine the heart the dog must have had at that age to guide a sled team in such conditions and for such a distance. It's incredible when you realize it actually happened.A thoroughly enjoyable family film depicting the real story of courage and heart. As a dog lover, this is a keeper for my dog story shelf and one I will return periodically for sure.Run Togo Run !!
This movie is definitely worth a watch, such a heartbreaking movie! If you are a dog owner this movie will touch you for sure..

I have always had a great interest in the Northern wilderness, particularly Alaska and sled dogs. I had read various accounts of the great serum run from online sources as well as the book, "The Cruelest Miles," many of which hail Balto, although an important and tenacious dog, as the hero of the story. However, when you dig a bit more and read accounts from diaries of mushers and families whose children lived (and thus generations of families) because of Seppala and Togo's heroism, you see the real truth. Without those two, their speed and tenacity, the serum simply would not have made it to Nome. This film, tells the truth in a way that is utterly heartwarming without being syrupy and "Disney-ish." I've always admired Dafoe, but he gives a wonderfully understated performance that draws you into the story as if you were there watching it all in person. A beautiful, triumphant film that reminds you that the will of a spirit and heart can truly make miracles happen. As an aside, puppy Togo is about the most adorable creature I've ever seen!!

My BF and I loved the Movie it was very Funny when Togo figures out how to get out of the Barn and goes back to he's Owner . The water Scene where they are Mushing though the Somewhat Frozen Ice water not once but Twice has us on edge of bed . But that's all will say about the Movie

I highly recommend this movie if you are a dog lover.

reviews.review_title: Perfect casting choice for an almost perfect movie.
reviews.content: Wow. I don't know what I was expecting, but that movie was amazing. I never thought I'd enjoy a movie about a frigging dog-sled, but it was so damn good. I laughed, I cried, I gasped, I was on the edge of my seat during some parts and giggling away at others. Too slow-paced for kids, but definitely a good watch for adults. Also interesting because it's damn near spot on accurate to the real story (or so I read afterwards), and yet it's STILL exciting AF. Well worth the watch.Also, Willem Dafoe was the perfect casting choice for the lead. Google pictures of the guy, they could be brothers. Wow.

This is a good Disney+ original drama about the 1925 serum run to Nome, Alaska, the same subject as the 1995 animated cult classic, Balto, although Togo is much more accurate to the true story than that film was. This movie features some really solid performances, with Willem Dafoe being the standout, as is usually the case. If you like dogs, definitely watch this movie! It has cute dogs everywhere, and I think they are mostly real with minimal CGI. I'm always amazed at how expressive these animals can be and what they can be trained to do. The subject matter of the movie was very interesting, I feel like I learned something about history from watching it. It also features some really intense and thrilling action sequences that had me on the edge of my seat! I wasn't that into the structure of the film, it was told in a nonlinear way that kinda took me out of the experience sometimes. That, and I didn't think the cinematography or the editing were anything to write home about, but other than that this is a good movie that gives you a good old-fashioned triumphant feeling. It's worth a watch if you have Disney+.

CGI was used but sparingly I felt, a few touching moments to help you feel invested, and a warm ending all add up to a great film. Enjoy that they chose not to voice over Togo (the sled dog) always find that tacky. Only real gripe with the film is it seems to contradict the story told in earlier Disney pretrails of the story in Balto.. without some serious reading it's hard to tell which story stays more true to the real events... Seems like typical Disney re writing history even its own to fit it's needs, but besides that a great watch, obviously family friendly but didn't feel forced, definitely be watching this again soon!

reviews.review_title: It was heartbreaking getting to know the real story

Wow great movie about this event. Sad that it took so many years for people to get the story right. God bless you Seppala and Togo.

Wow, just wow. What an amazing film and an incredible story. I don't even know where to start. First off, I have no idea how they were able to train those dogs to act the way they did in that movie, that in my mind, was pretty incredible. Based on the film making and the movie as a whole, I would consider it a masterpiece. The storyline had a perfect blend between timelines that came together to tell the story of Togo in an amazing way. I was able to understand this dogs life and the life of the owners ever since he was a pup. The story from 1925 in general was incredible just to see. How 20 teams in this "serum run" ran the relay, where all of them ran 31 miles except for one of them running 264. I personally, love historic movies and this one came second to none. I'm not sure how accurate it was, but they made it seem that Balto, the dog that finished the "serum run" was the villain because the press praised him instead of Togo. Personally, that iritates me off a little, but I could care less because this movie was a 10/10. It's frustrating that this movie is only on Disney+, I would like to see it released in theaters and find out how other critics and just normal movie goers think of the movie. The conclusion and ending to this movie was nothing but excellent. The sound editing between the breathing of the dogs, running, thoughts from the owner (Willem Dafoe), who did such an incredible job in this one I personally think this is his best movie. The ending of the movie was so touching it was incredible. It's sometimes hard to explain how good this movie is, you'll just have to see it yourself to believe me. But, I guarantee, you do not want to pass up seeing this film.

reviews.review_title: Evokes Powerful Emotions Through Simple Narrative Devices.
reviews.content: As a constant, the most powerful stories told in Cinema aren't overly complex, always consisting of those basic human elements which resonate even among the sternest of watchers. Yet, simple stories are often the hardest to put to film, as undoubtedly the immediacy and banality of the medium make it difficult to retain the more profound nature of the written word."Togo" tells the often-elusive simple story elegantly, without pretense, in the very fashion which auteurs strive for, almost as elegantly as Jonas Mekas nostalgic landscapes or Sokurov's poetic images.Dafoe's performance has immense power, in every crease and rugged line which speak more than words ever could, and manages to project the bond between man and beast effortlessly throughout, never needing to say more than a few words to speak straight to the heart.A lesson to those wishing to cross-pollinate between mediums perhaps, creating a confusing mish-mash of nothings; moving pictures are simple things, if only you can manage to capture the moment in the image whilst retaining its apparent simplicity, without needless hyperbole.

In 1925 a small town in Alaska had an outbreak of diphtheria. With a massive storm closing in there is no way other than man and sled dog to make the 650 mile trip through treacherous Alaskan country in a deadly blizzard. This is the story of Leonhard Seppala and his amazing sled dog named Togo and their journey to collect the serum to save a town of children from this deadly virus.
This is a remarkable story with great performances in particular by Willem Dafoe and the rest of the cast (including dogs of course). It definately tugs at the heart strings and show why the Seppala Siberian is an extremely valuable breed of working dog. A great movie for the fam. 1 of the best I've seen. 10 stars.

I've watched Balto as a kid, and while watching this movie i was wondering why this looks so familiar, are the 2 stories connected. It turned out that This is the better half (or more like 70%) of the story of Balto.The movie itself is very good. It focuses on the interaction between the man and his dog/s more than the medicine they have to deliver. Yet another very good role of Defo, which was not surprising at all.Sound and camera work are superb, script and dialogues are very good too - simple, clean and without any useless thing to get extra minutes.It also shows how the media works - Balto gets all the credits while the real hero stays in the shadows unknown for over 50 years. Not that Balto and his owner are not heroes as well, don't get me wrong, i'm just paying my respect where it's due.

A shockingly good movie. The only 'bone of contention' was it's absence of cultural coloring. Alaska ... such great opportunities for enlightenment of the audience. Or the many Native tribes, some in the Nome area who would still have spoken Russian. There IS such a thing as TOO clean.

I admit it, I'm a sentimentalist. I cried like a baby at my own wedding while my wife looked on in bemusement. I weep at favourite songs or pieces of music and shed tears freely at emotionally charged movies. It was my wife's brother who recommended we watch this movie during lockdown and I really should have read the signs. First off it's a Disney movie, secondly it's about a brave dog ...and right from these two facts, I knew I was going to struggle to get through it dry-eyed.And so it proved. With films like this, for me anyway, critical faculties are suspended and you just get caught up in the action and want it all to end happily, especially for the dogs. I do know that Willem Dafoe and Julianne Nicholson were excellent in their parts as the slightly mismatched couple who set up home in the remote, frozen, northernmost part of America. He's the local "mush-man" responsible for trekking his team of husky dogs over unforgiving terrain for the benefit of the local community while she provides all the back-up back home he needs for them both to keep their operation going.Comes a catastrophic diphtheria outbreak to the town, especially targeting young children and the need to requisition urgent medical supplies from some 500 miles or so away, but with an impending spell of bad weather knocking out the possible use of aeroplane or rail transport, the only way to go get the job done is for Dafoe and his dogs to undertake a hazardous cross-country trek like no other to collect the vaccines and get them back to the hospital to help save the kids' lives.With a storyline given added topicality and piquancy by the devastating Covid-19 virus outbreak, this was a thrilling and moving race against time, taking on the elements and indeed the odds, the effort spearheaded by crusty old Dafoe and his pack, especially Togo the pack-leading dog. Early on we're fed the back story of how Togo came into the couple's possession and how the dog's irrepressible desire to accompany Dafoe on his travels sees him twice unsuccessfully try to offload the dog to new owners, only for Togo to somehow find a way to break free and return back home from whence he came. Finally Dafoe is persuaded by the dog's errr... doggedness, to reluctantly road-test the apparently under-sized dog and eventually concede that its courage and stamina outweigh any physical disadvantages it may have.We see the pack endure unbelievable dangers in their epic mission, Togo literally pulling out all the stops to navigate the team over breaking ice-floes, slog up snow-bound foot-hills and even save the group from certain doom near the end, in a particularly amazing show of love, strength and fortitude by the dog.It's a Disney film so there's probably a fair bit of dramatic licence taken with the story but you'll have a good idea how it ends. The landscapes, making great use of drone shots on-high are frequently eye-catching and there's was a plaintive lonesome-violin soundtrack which further set the scene. I don't know how much of the cinematography was C-Gen assisted but the actions of the dogs and Togo in particular, looked natural to me.Anyway I got through to the end dry-eyed and dog-tired, to quote Elvis Costello, and immediately afterwards felt the need to hug our own dog of over ten years in sympathy and appreciation for what I'd just seen.This one's for you, Flip.

The premise shows there should be breath-taking scenes but the stupid person incharge thought they should fill the entirety of the film with digital bluring with overstaurated chromatic aberration settings which just proves better technology does not make something better so Togo goes to the bottom of the pile well below the live action remakes and the made for TV movies that Disney as done which I didn't think would ever happen.

Absolutely love this movie. It's very inspiring and a movie you'll be thankful you watched. I grew up in the dog mushing capital of the world, Tok, Alaska. For decades until the 1970s Tok was home to the world sled dog championship, and I lived a quarter mile from the start. I grew up watching George Attla and Dr. Roland Lumbard compete with 8 and 7 world championships, respectively. Togo exaggerated the drama of the ice flow breaking up, but they always do in Hollywood. Willem Defoe carried the entire weight of the cast with his commanding charisma. The rest of the cast might as well have stayed home. All except Togo. Love this movie.
I rarely cry in movies but with this movie and this adorable story, I couldn't hold my tears, Good dogs.. HIKE!
A great film and well acted. Loved the dog and very emotional. A must watch for an evening

reviews.review_title: Should have gotten Academy Award nomination for 2019
reviews.content: We subscribed to Disney + and my 6 year old son loves dog movies, so I thought we would try it out, expecting it to be a campy Disney movie. It wasn't. The best movie I have seen in 2019. Should get best picture nomination IMHO. It is based on a true story, but of course the details are dramatized. The cinematography will take your breath away. Living in Nome Alaska in 1925 would be like living in hell for most of us, but it still shines with beauty - the mountains, the ice and oceans. The story was interesting and I learned much about the illnesses that struck then and dog sledding. The acting from the dogs was the best I've seen in a Disney film. And Dafoe fit the mold of a Norwegian immigrant to Alaska. No movie is perfect so I only give it a 9, as there are SOME boring parts I suppose.

reviews.review_title: Dogs are the purest living souls on the planet.
reviews.content: Beautiful film about a mans relationship with his dog.

reviews.review_title: I've seen better films with worse reviews.
reviews.content: Maybe it's because I'm european but I don't know anything about this story whatsoever and this movie is my way of discovering it. That being said.. what's with all the praise?The Special FX and cinematography are bad, everything looks fake, I don't think I've seen a sky that wasn't added and/or created in a computer... And what's up with the weird blurry letterbox and digitally added pixel noise?? It's awful and just made the film unbearable to watch. The soundtrack is just an annoying violin playing the same 3 notes for the entire movie. And I haven't even started on the story...For me the story was painstakingly predictable and just boring, it felt like the entire film was the exact same scene with different dialogue options. Not a single character was actually interesting and the flashbacks are unnecessary. I didn't feel a connection with any of the characters and therefore the movie never really touched me.As the titel says... I've seen some great and fun films that don't get the praise this film does. And it feels like a lot of people are just biased because they liked the story before they even made it into a movie. It's certainly not a "bad" film but it's also not nearly worth the solid 8 it has at the time of writing this review.
I watched the movie with interest, a very beautiful and sad movie

reviews.review_title: Amazing movie and finally Togo gets his recognition!

reviews.review_title: Perfect movie for #stay-at-home with your kids
reviews.content: Just watched this with my 3 kids during the COVID lockdown. What an amazing story, so beautifully told.I'm a 45-old cynical jerk, but my heart was literally _aching_ during the frozen bay crossing scene - are they gonna make it or not? Will they reach the shore or not? What if they drop the antitoxin?All my kids kept crying after the movie ended, so we actually had to go to Wikipedia to make sure that Togo had survived and actually lived happily years after the run. Only after doing all that the kids have agreed to go to sleep :-)PS. Kudos to Willem Defoe and Julianne Nicholson for perfect acting and huge thanks to the film makers for creating this.

Watching in 2021.We are a cat family but after this my family want a dog. Great cinematography and use of greenscreen. The scenes across the ice were exhilarating with William Dafoe expelling dialogue like a shakesperean monologue as the ice fractured all around. A fantastic performance from the lead acting dog to such an extent I was in floods of tears with my 10 & 11 year olds! A Disney triumph! Ps ... I'm looking for a dog tomorrow!

A strongly touching film. I didn't expect less from Disney. It's based on a true story and this makes it more interesting to watch. The Disney company gives life to a story that reminds us the animated movie of Balto. Heroic actions, adventure, love between man and dog and real life difficulties with William Dafoe on a pretty good act. I totally recommend it, especially for dog lovers. Huskies for the win!!!

reviews.review_title: A mediocre movie about an outstanding story
reviews.content: Great Race of Mercy. One of the most beautiful and touching pages of the History of Humanity. Leonhard Seppala and Togo. Successful beginning of massive vaccine company in the whole USA. The birth of the modern Siberian Husky race, both working dog and home pet.I don't pretend the respect of all historical details. But at least the main points should be revealed. We are speaking about the risk for the life of at least TEN THOUSANDS of persons, leaving in the zone! In the movie seems that they are trying to save only a handful of children. No idea at all about the caliber of the possible catastrophe. No idea about at least 5 dogs that had lost their lives during the Race, no idea about the numerous frostbites of the mushers.It could be a really GREAT movie. Great and touching. I expected so much to see it... really disappointing. It was just flaccid. Flaccid and somewhere boring. What a pity. I advise everybody who liked this film - just try to read about the real story. Wherever you want. Also Wikipedia can be OK. It is much more moving, trust me!

A true story about the misunderstanding that we humans have about the relationship with the amazing canine. As the movie unfurls with beautiful landscapes we learn of the heroic yet miraculous feats this lovely animal performs, while we believe that he is driven to his task.
As the musher later admits it was not the drive to achieve the duty it was a drive to be with and work for the human, my goodness they are amazing creatures.

Special effects were a bit OTT, certainly didn't expect a historically accurate documentary as some reviewers clearly wanted, as for the animal rights activists, pretty sure this wasn't considered a 'hobby' back in the 20's.As a film, thoroughly enjoyed it, serious story line with a touch of humour.

reviews.review_title: A Sweet Family Movie to Watch With Your Dog
reviews.content: I don't know if it's the pregnancy hormones or if I just really loved this movie, but I'm practically tearing up writing this review. It was such an unexpected gem - and I learned something I never knew about. I just happened to turn it on one evening as I was sitting with my toddler who loves dogs and thought it would be something good to have going on in the background while we played and hung out. And then Willem Dafoe's face came up on the screen and I was like "Okay, you had my interest, but now you have my attention." The film struck the right balance between moments of suspense, heartwarming scenes, funny moments where Togo is being a mischievous pup, and the few scenes that had me vigorously wiping away my tears before anyone could see. It wasn't too heavy handed in any of these areas, in my opinion, and I appreciated the history lesson that came with it. I also appreciated that it had an overall happy ending. I generally refuse to watch animal movies because they piss me off when something happens to the animal, but this ending had us walking away feeling happier and more connected to our own mischievous pups than before we started watching. Dogs truly are man's (and woman's!) best friend!

I've seen Togo a few times, and I love it. It's based entirely on the excellent story of Togo, a sled dog with intelligence, stamina, courage, and, most importantly, heart, and his crucial part in saving Nome, Alaska from a horrible diphtheria epidemic. Togo looks almost exactly like he did in real life, except for the eyes. Willem Dafoe is excellent in the role of Togo's musher, the famed Leonhard Seppala, and delivers so many funny lines ("Next time I go the wrong way, you tell me to go to h***!")! The story is very touching and amazing at the same time!!!! And most importantly, this movie delivers a heartwarming message that even when loyal dogs leave you, they'll stay harnessed to your heart until the day you leave this world behind! It also acknowledges that while the press gave the credit to the final team's lead dog, Balto, and his musher, Gunnar Kaasen (since they actually brought the medicine into Nome), and Balto even received his own statue in New York (which I visited), Togo will always be remembered as the true savior of Nome, since he lead Seppala and his team across the most dangerous bit of the serum run.Overall, Togo is a remarkable improvement over Amblimation's 1995 animated box office disappointment, Balto, which was far too mean-spirited and riddled with uncanny animation and historical lies, including violent and scary moments that never happened. I can't believe Steven Spielberg would subject kids to something like that!!!! Balto's only redeeming factor was probably its music (the late, great James Horner's thunderous score and Steve Winwood's gorgeous, inspirational blue-eyed soul ballad, "Reach For The Light"). Avoid Balto, but Togo is a compulsory viewing.

reviews.review_title: A authentic true story and a genuine tear-jerker
reviews.content: Togo hitting me in ways I was not prepared for. As a historian the events that it covers are completely remarkable. As and academic with a BFA in film production I appreciated all of the nuances that were so well done. This story gets you invested in the characters and the reality of not only their situation but their history. Best investment pays off in spades. I found myself crying uncontrollably. I realize that I am hypersensitive because of the pandemic. But that takes nothing away from an incredible story of human nature combined with animal nature combined to save a society with unfathomable obstacles in the way. This is a must-see film. I would watch it again tomorrow. Must see.

reviews.review_title: Togo - the heart of a survivor and a hero for the ages
reviews.content: If anyone is looking for some inspiration for a film to watch, try Togo - available to stream on Disney+.Now, I wouldn't usually write a film review, but this one made such an impression on me, I feel I must do my part and spread the word.Firstly, this is a film about a 12yr old dog who pulls a sled 250+ miles in one of the worst Alaskan blizzards on record, to get a desperately needed diphtheria anti-toxin to the Alaskan town of Nome in 1925. The feat itself is truly incredible. There are no words, Togo is one of a kind. You may have heard of Balto? Well, this film is a historical correction of immense proportions. Turns out, Balto only ran 20 miles of the 640+ mile "great serum run" as it is known. This film is an emotional rollercoaster - it's fun, exciting, heartwarming and just what you need right now (trust me).Secondly, the acting, cinematography and cgi are amazing. Ok, this film is all about the dog, and what a powerful film it is, but I truly did not expect the visual feast that was scent (couldn't resist) my way. It's astounding what can be done these days.And of course, no film review would be complete without a mention of the soundtrack. It's good. Really good. And features some recognisable music (Arrival anyone?)It isn't very often that a film really moves me to want to tell the entire world about it. But I feel this film is such an underrated movie; I'd never heard of it before seeing it in the rolling promotion carousel on Disney+, and let's be honest, neither had you. And, like me, you'd probably never even heard the name Togo before. But you have now and all I can say is this film is full of heart and packs a powerful punch and is really deserving of a watch. And yes, it's very family friendly.So after you've watched it, if you're anything like me, when the credits start rolling, you might find yourself heading to Wikipedia to find out more (sorry it's the inner geek in me!) and believe me, you won't be disappointed.Watch it and thank me later.

reviews.review_title: The story could have been told in a much better way than this. Make your 10 year old children watch it.
reviews.content:
I am not even giving 4/10 to make the ranking of the movie lower. I think it deserves 4, and I think people are giving 10/10 because it is based on a true story, and it is a dog movie.The worst part is there was no emotion in the movie. They figured out everything quickly. There was always a quick solution. I never felt like they could not have done it. I never felt the failure so they can come back with determination, passion and ambition. Everything was too quick yet the movies is really boring.He did not accept the dog at first since he was a bit too playful and moving. However, one day he accepts him suddenly.The script is too poor. I just watched the movie yet I dont even remember any quotes from the movie besides Dafoe saying "Good dogs!"The story could have been told from a different perspective, so it is not always "Togo, Togo"
The scenerio could have been much more emphatic, powerful, and uncertain. Therefore it is more gripping and shocking.I am a bit dissappointed in the imdb ranking. So I felt like I had to write a review. There are much more impressive movies than this to make your children to see.
Not just a movie , story of the brave dog which saved the lives of many people. TOGO is born with the heart of a survivor ! Inspiring to many !

reviews.review_title: These are heroes! This is courage!
reviews.content:
All you see nowadays are people throwing around the words "courage" and "heroic" to describe any mundane event or unremarkable person.
Those words should only be used to describe anyone like the two main characters of this film.
This is more than just a tale about a man and his dog. This is a beautiful story about bravery, determination and risking all because it's the right thing to do and not in an attempt at glory.
I cried alot during the movie and now thinking of it I'm crying too. It's that touching and moving.
To think these two characters did what they did and aren't both immortalized with a statue or something is just inexplicable.
This film also taught me about a certain breed of dog that came into existence because of the real Togo.
Willem Dafoe proves again he's the European definition of actor, a true artist.
I was also relieved to see such a strong female character! Finally! I always admire these type of women that people often overlook or don't appreciate because she's a wife, a friend, a homemaker and a man's driving force.
And many times throughout the film her husband talks about her in a way you can tell there's alot of respect and admiration for her even when he says she's stubborn it's a compliment trust me!
What a beautiful marriage.
The wife is also fundamental to the story in different ways not just as the man's safe haven from the world. But I can't explain why without giving away the story.
That dog... one in a million. To be lucky enough to have had a dog like that must be extraordinary.
I almost didn't watch this film because my mind was comparing this to 2 other movies "snow dogs" with Cuba Gooding Jr and that Paul Walker film "Eight Below". Thankfully I ignored my mind's comparisons. This film is more in tune with "Eight below" but it's in a very different tone. I liked "Eight below" alot and "Togo" too.
This film requires your full attention because it jumps from one time to another. One minute you're seeing Togo as a pup the next Togo is struggling for survival. It doesn't confuse you if you're paying attention and it's also an interesting way of telling the story.
I didn't give it 10 stars because of a few scenes I don't agree with that have no relevance whatsoever to the story but were added for the reasons I don't agree with and I can't say what or this website will censor me and also other than that, this movie is a must.

reviews.review_title: Thank you, Disney for this masterpiece.

What else do you want from a movie. It moves you inspires you and takes you on a memorable journeyA masterpiece in my humble opinion.

Perfectly paced story, an historic event and how a Norwegian migrant and his dogs saved a town in Alaska which was suffering from a terrible pandemic.It's the story of a couple who bred sled dogs, and one in particular who was the greatest hero and friend.The script is really good: the friendship between the protagonists, the sacrifice and the endurance... the performances are really good.Fans of history, family values, dogs and nature are not going to be disappointed watching this movie. Since 1925, Balto has earned universal acclaim, legions of fans, and a commemorative bronze statue in New York City's Central Park. But Togo 2019 corrects the historical record in favor of an underdog. As it turns out, Balto was just one of more than 100 pups who made that lifesaving dogsled relay to Nome possible. Balto did lead the canine team over the final 55-mile stretch of the journey. But, the real hero dog, Togo, ran 264 miles and led it through some of the riskiest spots.

There are the mildest of spoilers in the following review - for any who would prefer a completely unspoiled viewing experience I'll just say go watch the movie - quick!Like many, I swallowed the story of Balto being the hero of the Fairbanks to Nome desperation dog-sled Serum Run, and though I knew Balto didn't lead the only team on this heroic 600 mile journey, I had no idea that another team, lead by another dog and driven by another musher had gone 264 miles, including crossing a trecherous frozen sound - twice - while the other 19 teams averaged 31 miles. (The Balto team completed the final 55 miles, which was heroic enough, but as the team that arrived with the life-saving diptheria serum, Balto got to be the hero. Ironically, Leonhard Seppala was the owner of both Balto and Togo, but Seppala wanted the best dogs on the longest and most treacherous part of the journey and Balto didn't make the "first team."As a story, it's exhilarating, but the acting and cinematography and other elements such as costuming and editing and music all add up to by far the best "dog movie" I've seen. Playing Leonhard and Constance Seppala are Willem Dafoe and Julianne Nicholson are excellent actors and they have real chemistry with each other and with the dogs. Drones and other innovative techniques are used to capture brilliant "live" footage with what I assume must have included some CGI shots for the harrowing journey across Norton Sound, which I don't doubt was breaking up in real life - I learned that the movie gets this part right: the ice had completely broken up and floated out to see the next morning.I'm a little curious: The real Seppala's had a daughter who was 8 and living with them in Nome. For some reason she is not shown or mentioned and there is even a scene where Constance is questioning Leonhard's motivation for making this death-defying run, during which Leonhard explains that they know several of these children and their parents. Since all three household members, but especially young Sigrid, were vulnerable in an isolated town in the midst of a raging diphtheria epidemic with no other cures available, I'm just a little curious why this wasn't depicted in the film.

reviews.review_title: A Masterpiece - a Beautiful Story Told Touchingly!
reviews.content:
Togo is a symphony of the heart.
I watched this movie 7 times.
Everson Core's cinematography is magnificent. The dog sledding scenes, of course, but also how he uses window panes to frame a scene. The lighting of the indoor scenes make you feel like you are there.
Willem Defoe portraying Leonhard Seppala feels genuine and real, especially how he bonds with Togo. You know this is one of Defoe's best acting performances ever,
because it does not feel like he is acting.
Julianne Nicholson is perfect as Seppala's wife and her facial expressions make you feel what she is feeling.
The writing by Tom Flynn is just wonderful. For instance, when Seppala declares, "He's (Togo) not a sled dog, he's a lead dog!"
The music by Mark Isham arouses your emotions. And will make you cry. Isham is gifted.
There are many others who contributed to this movie to make it a Masterpiece!
I wish I could shake the hand of all those involved.

reviews.review_title: The True Story, BALTO is a farse. TOGO is the real deal.
reviews.content: This movie was emotional, suspenseful, heart warming and tear jerking at the same time. William Dafoe had an excellent performance as Norwegian immigrant who moves to Nome Alaska in search of gold. He never finds gold, but he finds his obvious calling to be a dog sled musher and driver. He raises pups and trains them to race and deliver. Then comes Togo, Togo barely survives in beginning, he's the runt of the litter. He is called weak and small but you can never underestimate the heart of a survivor and champion. Togo causes problems for his owner in the beginning and tries to get rid of togo. His owner doesn't believe in him but Togo continues to show his worth and finally he is made lead sled dog and in doing so, creates a ripple effect throughout history. Togo is a true hero and this story tells you why Balto received the credit instead of Togo. A new line of dogs is bred from Togo. Such a moving and touching story of man's best friend and how important they can be in your life and others. If you love animals or dogs in general, you will love this movie. 10/10 for humanity

I admit it, I'm a sentimentalist. I cried like a baby at my own wedding while my wife looked on in bemusement. I weep at favourite songs or pieces of music and shed tears freely at emotionally charged movies. It was my wife's brother who recommended we watch this movie during lockdown and I really should have read the signs. First off it's a Disney movie, secondly it's about a brave dog ...and right from these two facts, I knew I was going to struggle to get through it dry-eyed.And so it proved. With films like this, for me anyway, critical faculties are suspended and you just get caught up in the action and want it all to end happily, especially for the dogs. I do know that Willem Dafoe and Julianne Nicholson were excellent in their parts as the slightly mismatched couple who set up home in the remote, frozen, northernmost part of America. He's the local "mush-man" responsible for trekking his team of husky dogs over unforgiving terrain for the benefit of the local community while she provides all the back-up back home he needs for them both to keep their operation going.Comes a catastrophic diphtheria outbreak to the town, especially targeting young children and the need to requisition urgent medical supplies from some 500 miles or so away, but with an impending spell of bad weather knocking out the possible use of aeroplane or rail transport, the only way to go get the job done is for Dafoe and his dogs to undertake a hazardous cross-country trek like no other to collect the vaccines and get them back to the hospital to help save the kids' lives.This was a thrilling and moving race against time, taking on the elements and indeed the odds, the effort spearheaded by crusty old Dafoe and his pack, especially Togo the pack-leading dog. Early on we're fed the back story of how Togo came into the couple's possession and how the dog's irrepressible desire to accompany Dafoe on his travels sees him twice unsuccessfully try to offload the dog to new owners, only for Togo to somehow find a way to break free and return back home from whence he came. Finally Dafoe is persuaded by the dog's errr... doggedness, to reluctantly road-test the apparently under-sized dog and eventually concede that its courage and stamina outweigh any physical disadvantages it may have.We see the pack endure unbelievable dangers in their epic mission, Togo literally pulling out all the stops to navigate the team over breaking ice-floes, slog up snow-bound foot-hills and even save the group from certain doom near the end, in a particularly amazing show of love, strength and fortitude by the dog.It's a Disney film so there's probably a fair bit of dramatic licence taken with the story but you'll have a good idea how it ends. The landscapes, making great use of drone shots on-high are frequently eye-catching and there's was a plaintive lonesome-violin soundtrack which further set the scene. I don't know how much of the cinematography was C-Gen assisted but the actions of the dogs and Togo in particular, looked natural to me.Anyway I got through to the end dry-eyed and dog-tired, to quote Elvis Costello, and immediately afterwards felt the need to hug our own dog of over ten years in sympathy and appreciation for what I'd just seen.

I recently watched the movie Togo on Disney +. I wasn't into it at first because it is based on a true story. Movies about true stories usually leave me crying. So my hopes for this movie were definitely not high. Then the movie began and I was immediately intrigued. The movie follows the journey of an older man named Leonhard Seppala, and his trusty 12 year old Husky Togo. Seppala leads his sled dog team, with Togo leading, across Alaska. The movie has noteworthy action scenes and a truly heartwarming backstory/plot. If you want to watch a fairly new movie that pulls at your heartstring, and feels you with a zest for life. Then Togo is the movie for you. It hits all the key points that a superb movie needs: charming characters, an extraordinary backstory, and adventure! In this 1 hour and 54 minute movie you become attached and almost connected with the characters. Overall I thought the movie Togo was a breathtaking film. That was able to accurately depict the true story of Togo and Leinhard Seppala.
This is the first time I leave a review ever! I just felt the need to it. The amount of emotions in this movie is incredible ! Togo had me in tears . MUST WATCH

reviews.review_title: Great family movie, great just everything movie
reviews.content: This was a spectacular movie. Spectacular scenery. The shots of the storm coming in, the dangerous trek over the ice -- it was spellbinding. We couldn't look away. How did they get those shots/effects?The acting was masterfully understated, with heroic, yet believable, characters. They really portrayed the time and place well. As someone of Norwegian descent who grew up in Alaska, I found nothing jarring as is far too often the case when someone tries to depict Alaska.And the dogs were amazing. Particularly Togo, who is supposed to be played by one of his actual descendants. Add in the cute puppy and any animal lover, young or old, will be enthralled.Not wanting it to end, both my husband and I went to the internet to find our more about this heroic dog. The true story of Togo is reportedly even more amazing, but I thought Disney did a great job of turning this into an exciting, edge of your seat type of movie.Haven't enjoyed a movie this much in a very long time.

As a Siberian Husky owner for the last 14 years, this film NAILED the tenacious, stubborn, and often downright naughty nature of these stunning creatures. It also nailed their absolute desire to RUN. This breed live for it, and it really is evident here, I hope this shuts the naysayers up. As someone who volunteers for a Husky Rescue, I also hope this film DOESN'T encourage people to get one of these dogs without making a 100% commitment for life. They have personality in spades and are very different to most other breeds who will obey instantly.
William Dafoe was the perfect choice for Seppela. He is a dead ringer for the man himself.
It was hard to hold the tears in throughout this movie, and even knowing how it ends, I was on the edge of my seat in some scenes. The last few minutes had my husband and I downright SOBBING.

This is a good Disney+ original drama about the 1925 serum run to Nome, Alaska, the same subject as the 1995 animated cult classic, Balto, although Togo is much more accurate to the true story than that film was. This movie features someThis is a good Disney+ original drama about the 1925 serum run to Nome, Alaska, the same subject as the 1995 animated cult classic, Balto, although Togo is much more accurate to the true story than that film was. This movie features some really solid performances, with Willem Dafoe being the standout, as is usually the case. If you like dogs, definitely watch this movie! It has cute dogs everywhere, and I think they are mostly real with minimal CGI. I’m always amazed at how expressive these animals can be and what they can be trained to do. The subject matter of the movie was very interesting, I feel like I learned something about history from watching it. It also features some really intense and thrilling action sequences that had me on the edge of my seat! I wasn’t that into the structure of the film, it was told in a nonlinear way that kinda took me out of the experience sometimes. That, and I didn’t think the cinematography or the editing were anything to write home about, but other than that this is a good movie that gives you a good old-fashioned triumphant feeling. It’s worth a watch if you have Disney+.

Togo is without a doubt a surprise hit, in my opinion. When it comes to dog centric films, I tend to not watch them because let’s just be honest - most of them are sad. Beautiful, but sad. Togo may look like just another Disney dog movie, butTogo is without a doubt a surprise hit, in my opinion. When it comes to dog centric films, I tend to not watch them because let’s just be honest - most of them are sad. Beautiful, but sad. Togo may look like just another Disney dog movie, but it is so much more. This film blew me away from start to finish. And one really interesting fact about this film is it IS based on a true story. I even fact checked the movie after and was floored to find how truly faithful this movie is to the real events.If you grew up with the animated film Balto, I can’t recommend the watch more, it takes the story of a dog mushing adventure that we loved as kids but made for the whole family - and especially us adults.  Willem Dafoe again proves his worth as an actor, giving a beautiful performance and Julianne Nicholson was a brilliant cast to back his character up. Give it a watch - you don’t be disappointed.
It's okay but Willem Dafoe's performance is great. Music is also really good.

meta_summary: Togo is the untold true story set in the winter of 1925 that takes you across the treacherous terrain of the Alaskan tundra for an exhilarating and uplifting adventure that will test the strength, courage and determination of one man, Leonhard Seppala, and his lead sled dog, Togo.
